original: de yang yod pa nyid kyis ltos pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang yod pa nyid kyis ltos pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence is free from all dependence.

original: byed par mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di nyid bsam par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byed par mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di nyid bsam par bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what should be contemplated: it is not reasonable to make something that exists.

original: gzhan yang mngon par gsal ba bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i phyir dngos po yang med par byed par 'gyur ba'am dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du mngon par gsal ba yang yod pa nyid byed par thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par gsal ba bzhin du tha mi dad pa'i phyir dngos po yang med par byed par 'gyur ba'am dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du mngon par gsal ba yang yod pa nyid byed par thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, because it is not different from what is manifest, the existent would be made nonexistent, or, like the essence of the existent, the manifest would be made existent.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not reasonable,

original: bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir dang / thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: bogs dbyung du med pa'i phyir dang / thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: because there is nothing to add and because it would follow, absurdly, that there would be an infinite regress.

original: yod pa'i don gyi yul la yang rgyu'i bya ba 'dod pa ni rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu byed pa ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa'i don gyi yul la yang rgyu'i bya ba 'dod pa ni rgyu rnams kyi 'bras bu byed pa ldog pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Also, if you accept that causes function with regard to existent objects, then it follows, absurdly, that the functioning of causes is never interrupted,

original: der ci zhig dmigs nas rgyu rnams ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: der ci zhig dmigs nas rgyu rnams ldog par 'gyur /
translated: for what would cause the causes to stop functioning with regard to that object?

original: 'bras bu yod pa'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is the existence of the effect, then that is not so,üîΩbecause

original: khyed kyi lugs kyis de ni sngar yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs kyis de ni sngar yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in your system, it is already existent.

original: de lta bas na gang gis rgyu yod pa ni med pa nyid skye'i de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang gis rgyu yod pa ni med pa nyid skye'i de skyed par byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which has a cause is produced, but not that which is nonexistent, like the sky flower, because it does not have a cause that produces it.

original: des na rgyu'i nus pas so sor nges pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rgyu'i nus pas so sor nges pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the relation of cause and effect is ascertained because the power of the cause is ascertained.

original: dngos po thams cad skyed pa'i nus pa yod par khas blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad skyed pa'i nus pa yod par khas blang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: One should not accept that all things have the power to produce everything,

original: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni thog ma med pa'i rang gi rgyu brgyud pas nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni thog ma med pa'i rang gi rgyu brgyud pas nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the power of things is ascertained by their own beginningless causal continuum.

original: gal te yang tshad ma med pa gzhan gyi bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir de rang las yin par brjod na /
analyzed: gal te yang tshad ma med pa gzhan gyi bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir de rang las yin par brjod na /
translated: If you say that a valid cognition is from itself because it is not possible for it to be produced by another without a valid cognition,

original: 'o na tshad ma ma yin pa yang rigs pa 'di nyid kyis rang nyid las yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: 'o na tshad ma ma yin pa yang rigs pa 'di nyid kyis rang nyid las yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: then by this very reasoning, an invalid cognition would also be from itself, and this is absurd.

original: gang yang tshad ma nyid ces bya ba rnam par shes pa'i don yongs su gcod pa bskyed pa'i nus pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yang tshad ma nyid ces bya ba rnam par shes pa'i don yongs su gcod pa bskyed pa'i nus pa yin la /
translated: Also, what is called valid knowledge is the capacity to generate the ascertainment of an object of consciousness.

original: nus pa yang rnam par shes pa skad cig ma la brten pa'i phyir yod par bya @222b ba nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa yang rnam par shes pa skad cig ma la brten pa'i phyir yod par bya @222b ba nus pa ma yin te /
translated: And since that capacity is based on a moment of consciousness, it cannot be said to exist prior to the consciousness.

original: dus gsum du yang de byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum du yang de byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it performs its function in the three times.

original: 'di ltar re zhig rnam par shes pa skyes pa las sngar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig rnam par shes pa skyes pa las sngar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In this way, first, it is not that the capacity exists prior to the arising of the consciousness.

original: brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brten pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is based.

original: brten pa rten pa med par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: brten pa rten pa med par byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that what is based does not have a basis.

original: rtsig pa med par ri mo bzhin te /
analyzed: rtsig pa med par ri mo bzhin te /
translated: Like a painting without a wall.

original: mi brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brten pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would not be based.

original: de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig tu byed par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir lhan cig tu byed par yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: For that reason, it is also not logical that it exists simultaneously with the consciousness.

original: rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would have no basis.

original: rten dang brten pa rtsig pa dang ri mo dag ni cig car rtsom pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rten dang brten pa rtsig pa dang ri mo dag ni cig car rtsom pa ma yin la /
translated: A wall and a painting do not begin simultaneously.

original: dus de tsam du gnas pa med pa'i sgo nas de nyid skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir skyes pa na rnam par shes pa phyis byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus de tsam du gnas pa med pa'i sgo nas de nyid skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir skyes pa na rnam par shes pa phyis byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Because it does not endure at that time, it is momentary. Therefore, when it arises, it does not produce a later consciousness.

original: des na tshad ma thams cad rang las tshad mar brjod par bya'o snyam du sems pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na tshad ma thams cad rang las tshad mar brjod par bya'o snyam du sems pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to think that all valid knowledge is valid knowledge in relation to itself.

original: 'di ltar re zhig don yongs su gcod pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa tshad ma nyid yin na zhes gang smras pa de ni 'brel ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig don yongs su gcod pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa tshad ma nyid yin na zhes gang smras pa de ni 'brel ba med pa yin te /
translated: In that case, the statement, ‚ÄúValid knowledge is the capacity to generate ascertainment of an object,‚Äù is irrelevant.

original: don yongs su gcod pa ni shes pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: don yongs su gcod pa ni shes pa'i rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: This is because ascertainment of an object is a synonym for consciousness.

original: nus pa shes pa de nyid la brten pa yin na de skyed par byed pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa shes pa de nyid la brten pa yin na de skyed par byed pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: If that capacity is based on the consciousness itself, it is not tenable that it is that which generates it.

original: mi brten pa nyid du thal bar gyur ba'i phyir dang / dus mnyam pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brten pa nyid du thal bar gyur ba'i phyir dang / dus mnyam pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would follow that it would not be based on it, and because it is not tenable that cause and effect are simultaneous.

original: gang yang brten pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig dang sngar byed pa ma yin no zhes smras pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang brten pa yin pa'i phyir lhan cig dang sngar byed pa ma yin no zhes smras pa de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not tenable to say that it is not simultaneous or prior to that which is supported,

original: tha mi dad pas brten pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pas brten pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that it is supported, since it is not different.

original: khyad par can gyi don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid de'i dngos po tsam shes par 'dod pa na nus pa zhes tha snyad du bya'i /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi don bya ba byed pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid de'i dngos po tsam shes par 'dod pa na nus pa zhes tha snyad du bya'i /
translated: The nature of an entity that performs the function of a specific object is called ‚Äúpotential‚Äù when one wishes to know just that entity.

original: don gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a different object.

original: don gzhan yin na dngos po byed pa po ma yin par thal ba dang 'brel ba yang ma grub po zhes 'di ni rnam pa mang du dpyad zin to //üîΩde lta bas na rnam par shes pa'i nus pa rang bzhin du gyur pa ni grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rnam par shes pa las sngar med pas de kho na byed do zhes bya
analyzed: don gzhan yin na dngos po byed pa po ma yin par thal ba dang 'brel ba yang ma grub po zhes 'di ni rnam pa mang du dpyad zin to // de lta bas na rnam par shes pa'i nus pa rang bzhin du gyur pa ni grub pa dang bde ba tha mi dad pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rnam par shes pa las sngar med pas de kho na byed do zhes bya
translated: If it were a different object, it would follow that the entity would not be an agent, and the connection would not be established. This has already been analyzed in many ways.

original: bar 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: bar 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, since the potential of consciousness is not different from that which is established and pleasure, like the nature of consciousness itself, it is not prior to consciousness. Therefore, there is no contradiction in saying that it alone performs that function.

original: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye'o zhes bya ba yod pa rigs pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye'o zhes bya ba yod pa rigs pa kho na ste /
translated: It is only reasonable to say that it arises simultaneously with consciousness,

original: dngos por gyur pa'i chos ni dngos po dang lhan cig grub pa dang / bde ba gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnus pa @223a * //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i chos ni dngos po dang lhan cig grub pa dang / bde ba gcig yin pa'i phyir ro // nus pa @223a * //
translated: because a real entity is established together with a real entity, and they have the same one nature.

original: dngos po las tha dad pa yin du chug mod //
analyzed: dngos po las tha dad pa yin du chug mod //
translated: Even if the potency is different from the real entity,

original: de lta na yang yod pa dang med pa'i rten mi 'thad pa'i phyir brten pa nyid ma grub ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang yod pa dang med pa'i rten mi 'thad pa'i phyir brten pa nyid ma grub ste /
translated: still, because it is untenable that it is the support of the existent and the nonexistent, it is not established as a support.

original: 'di ltar re zhig yod pa ni rten ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig yod pa ni rten ma yin te /
translated: Thus, first, the existent is not a support,

original: de bdag nyid thams cad kyis grub pas ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bdag nyid thams cad kyis grub pas ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established in all its aspects and is therefore independent.

original: de ni de'i rten du yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i rten du yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also unreasonable that it is the support of the existent,

original: de ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir 'bigs byed dang gangs can bzhin no //üîΩdes gnas pa byed do zhe na /
analyzed: de ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir 'bigs byed dang gangs can bzhin no // des gnas pa byed do zhe na /
translated: because it does not perform any function at all, like the Vindhya and the Himalaya mountains.üîΩIf you say that it is the support of the existent because it causes it to endure,üîΩthen endurance is not different from the enduring thing,

original: mtshan nyid de gnas pa ni gnas pa po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid de gnas pa ni gnas pa po las tha mi dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: because

original: gnas pa'i rang bzhin nyid de ltar khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i sgo nas brjod kyi rten zhes gnas pa po'i mtshan nyid byed pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i rang bzhin nyid de ltar khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i sgo nas brjod kyi rten zhes gnas pa po'i mtshan nyid byed pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o //
translated: It is the nature of enduring, and is expressed in this way by the exclusion of other attributes, but not by the definition of the endurer.

original: gnas pa po las gnas pa tha dad pa yin na yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i gnas pa byed pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa po cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gnas pa po las gnas pa tha dad pa yin na yang don gzhan du gyur pa'i gnas pa byed pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa po cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Even if enduring is different from the endurer, since it is the cause of the transformation of the other, the endurer does not perform any function at all.

original: gzhan byed pa na gzhan la cung zad kyang byas pa zhes bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyi ga ltar na yang gnas par byed pa po ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan byed pa na gzhan la cung zad kyang byas pa zhes bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyi ga ltar na yang gnas par byed pa po ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is not the case that when one performs the function of another, one is called the performer of that other, in either case, the endurer does not perform any function at all.

original: gal te de dang 'brel ba'i dngos po byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dang 'brel ba'i dngos po byed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it performs the function of being related to that,

original: ma yin te gnas par bya ba dang gnas par byed pa gnyis gzhan du gnas pa dang ldan par gnas pa po dag lhan cig 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir dang / thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni phal cher dpyad zin to //
analyzed: ma yin te gnas par bya ba dang gnas par byed pa gnyis gzhan du gnas pa dang ldan par gnas pa po dag lhan cig 'brel ba ma grub pa'i phyir dang / thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di ni phal cher dpyad zin to //
translated: But that is not so, because it is not established that the two‚Äîthat which endures and that which makes it endure‚Äîare related, since that which is enduring and that which makes it endure are different, and because it would follow that there would be an infinite regress.

original: gzhan yang gal te dngos po'i gnas par byed pa gnas pa las don gzhan du gyur par khas len par byed pa de'i tshe gnas par byed pa gnas pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po 'ga' zhig kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te dngos po'i gnas par byed pa gnas pa las don gzhan du gyur par khas len par byed pa de'i tshe gnas par byed pa gnas pa yod pa'i phyir dngos po 'ga' zhig kyang 'jig par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that that which makes a thing endure is different from endurance, then since that which makes it endure would exist, no thing would disintegrate.

original: gnas pa yod na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu'i dbang gis 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnas pa yod na yang 'jig pa'i rgyu'i dbang gis 'jig par 'gyur ba yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: And it is not logical to say that even though endurance exists, it disintegrates due to the power of the cause of disintegration.

original: de yang cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig par byed pa nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'jig par byed pa nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: Because it does not perform any function, it is illogical that it causes disintegration.

original: 'di ltar de la yang ci dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i 'jig pa 'jig pa'i rgyus byed dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la yang ci dngos po las don gzhan du gyur pa'i 'jig pa 'jig pa'i rgyus byed dam /
translated: In this way, the following thought alone occurs to him: Does destruction, which is different from a thing, cause destruction?

original: 'on te dngos po nyid yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di nyid kho na 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dngos po nyid yin zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di nyid kho na 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Or is it a thing itself?

original: re zhig dngos po nyid byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dngos po nyid byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not a thing itself that causes destruction,

original: de ni grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is already established.

original: gzhan byed na yang dngos po la @223b cung zad kyang ma byas pa'i phyir dngos po de'i gnas skabs kho na yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa med pas 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes rgyas par brtan pa'i dngos po brtag par gtan la phab zin
analyzed: gzhan byed na yang dngos po la @223b cung zad kyang ma byas pa'i phyir dngos po de'i gnas skabs kho na yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa med pas 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed do zhes rgyas par brtan pa'i dngos po brtag par gtan la phab zin
translated: If it causes another, since it does not cause the slightest modification of a thing, because it is just the state of that thing, it does not cause the slightest destruction.üîΩThus it has been extensively determined in the examination of stable things.üîΩMoreover, is a thing by nature stable?

original: to // gzhan yang dngos po rang bzhin gyis brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin nam /üîΩmi brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin grang /
analyzed: to // gzhan yang dngos po rang bzhin gyis brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin nam /üîΩmi brtan pa'i rang bzhin yin grang /
translated: Or is it by nature unstable?

original: de la gal te dngos po mi brtan pa'i bdag nyid du rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin na de'i tshe des rang gi ngo bo grub pa las phyis dang nyid gnas par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ni 'jig pa dang gnas pa'i rgyu gnyi gas
analyzed: de la gal te dngos po mi brtan pa'i bdag nyid du rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin na de'i tshe des rang gi ngo bo grub pa las phyis dang nyid gnas par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ni 'jig pa dang gnas pa'i rgyu gnyi gas
translated: If things arise from their own causes with an unstable nature, then they would not endure later, after their nature is established.

original: cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin no /
analyzed: cung zad kyang byed pa ma yin no /
translated: Therefore neither cause of destruction nor cause of endurance would do anything at all.

original: ci ste rang bzhin gyi brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de lta na yang de'i rang bzhin gzhan nyid mi srid pa'i phyir 'jig par byed pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no /
analyzed: ci ste rang bzhin gyi brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de lta na yang de'i rang bzhin gzhan nyid mi srid pa'i phyir 'jig par byed pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no /
translated: But if they have a stable nature, then because it is impossible for that nature to be different, there would be no cause of destruction at all.

original: rang nyid gnas pa yin pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa 'ga' yang yod pa yin pas gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i rgyu gnyi ga ltar yang cung zad byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid gnas pa yin pa'i phyir gnas par byed pa 'ga' yang yod pa yin pas gnas pa dang 'jig pa'i rgyu gnyi ga ltar yang cung zad byed pa ma yin no //
translated: And because they would endure by themselves, there would be no cause of endurance at all. Therefore neither cause of destruction nor cause of endurance would do anything at all.

original: med pa rten yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa rten yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the case that nonthings are the basis of destruction and endurance.

original: de ni rang bzhin thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis brten pa nyid dang bya ba dag mi srid pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir nus pa brten pa nyid du ma grub po //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin thams cad dang bral ba nyid kyis brten pa nyid dang bya ba dag mi srid pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir nus pa brten pa nyid du ma grub po //
translated: Because it is devoid of all intrinsic reality, it is impossible for it to be a basis and to function, like the horns of a rabbit, therefore the basis of the capacity is not established.

original: grub na yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: grub na yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: Even if it were established, it would be uncertain,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa rnams kyang bum pa dang lhan cig skye bar mthong ba'i phyir dang tshad ma ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la brten pa rnams kyang bum pa dang lhan cig skye bar mthong ba'i phyir dang tshad ma ma yin pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: because even those that are based on form and so on are seen to arise simultaneously with the vase, and because it would follow that even an invalid cognition would be a valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar tshad ma ma yin pa yang bzlog pa'i don yongs su gcod pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshad ma ma yin pa yang bzlog pa'i don yongs su gcod pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa yin la /
translated: Thus, even an invalid cognition is the capacity to generate the ascertainment of the opposite object.

original: rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i nus pa yang dus gsum char du yang mi byed pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid gzhan du tshad ma ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi nus pa yang gnyis kho na las yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i nus pa yang dus gsum char du yang mi byed pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid gzhan du tshad ma ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi nus pa yang gnyis kho na las yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The capacity that is based on consciousness does not function in any of the three times, therefore the capacity that is the nature of a valid cognition or an invalid cognition would be only two.

analyzed: gang gi chos 'ga' zhig dus gsum du yang mi skye ba de ni ji ltar de'i yin par 'gyur te /

original: sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma yang rang las tshad mar grub pa na skul bar byed pa tshad ma nyid du grub pa'i phyir kho bo cag gzhan la tshad ma nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi 'bad pas ci zhig bya snyam du sems
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma yang rang las tshad mar grub pa na skul bar byed pa tshad ma nyid du grub pa'i phyir kho bo cag gzhan la tshad ma nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi 'bad pas ci zhig bya snyam du sems
translated: If valid knowledge derived from sound is established as valid knowledge from itself, then the instigator is established as valid knowledge. Therefore, what effort will we make to establish valid knowledge for others?

original: na / sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma rang las tshad ma nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: na / sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma rang las tshad ma nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: nyan pa brjod pa po dag gis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i tshad ma ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i tshad ma ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: rtag pa'i ngag gis bskyed pa dang / yid la gnas pa'i ngag gi rgyu la yod pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i ngag gis bskyed pa dang / yid la gnas pa'i ngag gi rgyu la yod pa'o //
translated: and that which is produced by a permanent voice, and that which exists as the cause of the voice that resides in the mind.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis po 'di la rgyu sun ma phyung ba nyid ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis po 'di la rgyu sun ma phyung ba nyid ston pa yin te /
translated: Here, the two types are shown to be unproven as causes.

original: re zhig rtag pa'i ngag gang yin pa de la nyan pa po dang smra ba pos byas pa'i nyes pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig rtag pa'i ngag gang yin pa de la nyan pa po dang smra ba pos byas pa'i nyes pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: First, in regard to that which is a permanent voice, the fault of being produced by the hearer and the speaker is not possible,

original: rtag tu rig pa'i bla ma ngag gis de 'don du bcug pa po rnams dang 'don pa po rnams kyis bskyangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rig pa'i bla ma ngag gis de 'don du bcug pa po rnams dang 'don pa po rnams kyis bskyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always produced by the voice of the teacher of knowledge, and because it is maintained by those who recite it and those who listen to it.

analyzed: gang yang yid ches pas smras pa de la yang brtse ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dag gi nyes pa rnams bkag pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang ngag rtag pa nyid sun ma phyung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang ngag rtag pa nyid sun ma phyung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In another way also, the permanence of the voice is shown to be unproven.

original: yang na byed pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na byed pa med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Or, if it is without a cause, etc.

original: nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs @227b pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs @227b pa ste /

original: skyes bu'i chos yin pa'i phyir byed pa po nyid la brten te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i chos yin pa'i phyir byed pa po nyid la brten te /

analyzed: de dag ji ltar brten pa po log pa na skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag dag las gnas par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that they are impermanent.

original: brten pa'i chos ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: brten pa'i chos ni 'di yin te /

original: rten gyi rjes su byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten gyi rjes su byed pa gang yin pa'o //

original: 'on te yon tan dag gi nyes pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir yid ches pa'i tshig tshad ma nyid du khas len na yon tan dag las tshad ma nyid yin par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te yon tan dag gi nyes pa rnams bsal ba'i phyir yid ches pa'i tshig tshad ma nyid du khas len na yon tan dag las tshad ma nyid yin par khas blangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the words of a trustworthy person are valid because they eliminate the faults of the qualities, then you are accepting that the qualities are valid.

original: de lta yin dang 'di la yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'di la yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /

original: de la skyon med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la skyon med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this qualm, he says, ‚ÄúThere is no fault in that.

analyzed: skyon med pa dang yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: ‚Äù That which has a nature that is faultless and endowed with good qualities is so called.

original: de ltar bstan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar bstan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThus taught‚Äù means

original: gal te de ltar mngon sum sogs //
analyzed: gal te de ltar mngon sum sogs //

original: tshad ma yon tan la rag las //
analyzed: tshad ma yon tan la rag las //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //

analyzed: de bsal zhes bya ba ni yon tan bsal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is removed‚Äù means that the quality is removed.

original: nyes pa med pa mtshon pa'i zhes bya ba nyes pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa mtshon pa'i zhes bya ba nyes pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIndicated by the absence of faults‚Äù means free from faults.

analyzed: yon tan rnams kyi bya ba ni nyes pa dgag pa tsam yin gyi tshad ma byed pa la ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //

translated: In order to anticipate this objection, it is said:

original: yon tan dag las nyes med na //
analyzed: yon tan dag las nyes med na //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ltar nyes pa med pa ni yon tan yongs su shes pas nges pa yin la /
translated: etc.üîΩThus, the absence of faults is ascertained by the complete knowledge of the qualities.

analyzed: yon tan yongs su shes pa yang slar yang nyes pa med pas tshad ma nyid du nges la /

original: de la yang nyes pa med pa ni yon tan dag la yongs su shes la de lta na yang de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par gzhag pa thams cad nyams pa thug pa med pa'i gnas skabs de nyid son 'dug pa yin
analyzed: de la yang nyes pa med pa ni yon tan dag la yongs su shes la de lta na yang de lta bu yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rnam par gzhag pa thams cad nyams pa thug pa med pa'i gnas skabs de nyid son 'dug pa yin
translated: And there is no fault in that, because the qualities are fully understood, and even so, it is just as it is, and all such presentations are just as they are, and one has arrived at the state of endless faultlessness.

original: no // skyon 'di med de zhes bya bas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: no // skyon 'di med de zhes bya bas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: He replies, ‚ÄúThere is no such fault.‚Äù

analyzed: de dag yod na zhes bya ba ni yon tan rnams yod na'o //

original: gal te skye bar mi 'gyur mod //
analyzed: gal te skye bar mi 'gyur mod //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if they do not arise‚Äù means even if they do not arise.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩde rnams kyis zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na / de rnams kyis zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: tshad ma nyid ni bsal ba min // zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //

original: ci'i phyir @228a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir @228a * //

analyzed: zhe na ; mi shes nyid phyir ro //

analyzed: yon tan gyis bkag pa'i phyir nyes pa rnams med pa kho na las ma skyes pa nyid yin no // ma bsal ba yi dbang po ni //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma bsal ba'i phyir grub pa yin te /

analyzed: spyir btang ba dmigs kyis bsal ba dang bral ba ni rang bzhin du grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa dag la ste /

analyzed: yang gi sgra ni skyes bus ma byas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad ces bya ba'o //

analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig tu skyes bus byas pa'i ngag la nyes pa mi 'byung ba de ltar yang srid pa kho na yin te /

analyzed: de dag ni de la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de ltar yin dang ji ltar yon tan rnams yod pa tsam gyis nyes pa bzlog par nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: If that is so, then how can the faults be overcome just by the existence of the good qualities?

original: de ji ltar /
analyzed: de ji ltar /

original: mi shes pa'i phyir da rnams kyis //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i phyir da rnams kyis //

original: tshad ma nyid ni bsal ba min //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ni bsal ba min //
translated: the validity of the words is not refuted.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar brjod ces dogs nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar brjod ces dogs nas /

analyzed: nyes pa yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: 'di snyam du kho bo cag gis gdon mi za bar skyes bus byas pa'i tshig tshad ma nyid du bsgrub pa ni ma yin mod kyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir rtsom pa 'di thams cad rig byed tshad ma nyid du grub par bya ba'i phyir yin la /

analyzed: de la gal te skyes bus byas pa'i tshig tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du gyur pa de lta na yang rig byed la tshad ma cung zad kyang med de /

analyzed: nyes pa'i dogs pa med pa nyid kyi tshad ma nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems so //
translated: because they are established as valid cognition that is free of the doubt of error.

original: des na ltos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: des na ltos pa med pa'i phyir //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la ji skad du bshad pa las de lta bas na rig byed ni tshad ma ma yin te /

analyzed: gzhan du ste gal te tshad ma gzhan gyi rtogs pa'i don la yang tshad ma 'jug par 'dod na /

analyzed: yang na rgyu ni skyon can las zhes bya ba ni blo zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //

analyzed: chos mthun pa tsam zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'i don dang skyes bu'i tshig gi tshig nyid la sogs pas mtshungs pa nyid do //

analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad la dngos po nyid la sogs pas chos mtshungs pa nyid brjod par nus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //

translated: ‚ÄúBy the reflection‚Äù means that just as a reflection arises immediately after a form, so too, immediately after the proof that is set forth by a Buddhist, the proof that is discordant with the Buddhist arises.

original: ba'i don to //üîΩ'di ltar rig byed kyi tshig ni brdzun ma yin te tshig yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i phyir me dro ba dang 'od gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyes bu'i tshig bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod par nus pa yin no //

translated: This is the meaning.üîΩIn this way, one can say that the words of the Vedas are not false because they are words, just like the words of a person, and fire is hot and luminous, and so on.

original: des ni rnam pa de lta bu'i mi mthun pa'i tshad mas bkag pa'i phyir ni gnod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des ni rnam pa de lta bu'i mi mthun pa'i tshad mas bkag pa'i phyir ni gnod pa'i phyir /

analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ba ste //

analyzed: tshad ma yin te skyon bral ba'i // rgyu yis bskyed phyir rtags dang ni //

analyzed: de lta yin dang / 'di yi nges pa gnod byed kyi //

analyzed: de lta yin dang skyes pa'i de ma thag nyid du tshad ma'i nges pa skyed pa dang mi skyed pa dag gis tshad ma dang cig shos gnyis nges pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa yongs su nges pa las rtogs pa dang ldan pa su yang 'jug par

analyzed: tshad ma bsam pa ni de'i don du yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'i tshul gyis zhen pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtog pa dang ldan pa don byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams tshad ma'am tshad ma ma yin pa'i tshul gyis zhen pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Because those who have understanding and who seek to accomplish the object do not adhere to it by way of valid knowledge or invalid knowledge.

original: don byed pa de yang btso ba dang sreg pa la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa skyed pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: don byed pa de yang btso ba dang sreg pa la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa skyed pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: And that accomplishment of the object has the characteristic of producing a consciousness that appears as cooking, burning, and so on,

original: de skyes pa nyid na don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'jug pa'i re ba ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skyes pa nyid na don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'jug pa'i re ba ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: because when that arises, the hope of engaging in seeking to accomplish the object is eliminated.

original: don byed pa'i shes pa de yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi rang nyid kyis 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa'i shes pa de yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyi rang nyid kyis 'byung ba yin te /
translated: And that consciousness that accomplishes the object arises by itself through reflexive awareness,üîΩbecause it is not tenable that the object is known by another consciousness.

original: gsal ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir de ma thag tu nyams su myong ba ji lta bzhin du rnam par dpyod pa'i shes pa skye bas nges pa'i phyir rang nyid las yin par grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gsal ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir de ma thag tu nyams su myong ba ji lta bzhin du rnam par dpyod pa'i shes pa skye bas nges pa'i phyir rang nyid las yin par grub pa yin gyi /
translated: Because the clarity of the object is experienced, the consciousness that analyzes the object arises immediately after the experience and ascertains the object. Thus, it is established that the object exists by itself.

original: gang gi don byed par snang ba'i shes pa gzhan skyed pa'i rjes su 'brang ba na thug pa med par 'gyur ba skyes bus de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu gzhan 'dod pa yang ma @236a * //
analyzed: gang gi don byed par snang ba'i shes pa gzhan skyed pa'i rjes su 'brang ba na thug pa med par 'gyur ba skyes bus de'i bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu gzhan 'dod pa yang ma @236a * //
translated: Nor is it asserted that a person establishes the object by producing another consciousness that appears to perform the object‚Äôs function, because that would lead to an infinite regress.

original: yin no // de bzhin du 'jig rten na ngoms pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod de /
analyzed: yin no // de bzhin du 'jig rten na ngoms pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod de /
translated: In the same way, people desire the result of satisfaction and so on.üîΩThat is established by the mere occurrence of the consciousness of satisfaction, the absence of pain, and so on.

original: de yang tshim pa dang yongs su gdung ba med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'byung ba nyid las mngon par grub po zhes bya ba de tsam gyis skye bo rnams yongs su mgu na ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir de rang las 'dod pa grub pa yin noüîΩzhes brjod do //
analyzed: de yang tshim pa dang yongs su gdung ba med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'byung ba nyid las mngon par grub po zhes bya ba de tsam gyis skye bo rnams yongs su mgu na ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir de rang las 'dod pa grub pa yin noüîΩzhes brjod do //
translated: If people are satisfied by that, then they stop. Thus, the object is established by itself.

original: de yang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can de'i de thob pa'i nus pa tshad ma zhes bya la /
analyzed: de yang de'i rgyur gyur pa'i shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can de'i de thob pa'i nus pa tshad ma zhes bya la /

original: nus pa de yang ma goms pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi shes pas nges par gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir phyis kyi 'bras bus shes pa 'jug par nges par byed pa'i phyir dang po gzhan las tshad ma nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: nus pa de yang ma goms pa'i phyir 'bras bu mi shes pas nges par gzung bar mi nus pa'i phyir phyis kyi 'bras bus shes pa 'jug par nges par byed pa'i phyir dang po gzhan las tshad ma nyid du brjod do //
translated: Since that potentiality is not familiarized, it cannot be ascertained because it is not known as the result. Therefore, in order to ascertain the engagement of the subsequent consciousness that is the result, the first is said to be valid knowledge in dependence on another.

analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang thug pa med pa spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to abandon the infinite regress in another way, he says:

analyzed: dang po dngos med yul can ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The first is the subject that is a nonentity.

analyzed: gal te dang po thog ma'i shes pa dngos po med pa la 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If the first, the initial consciousness, engages a nonentity,

analyzed: de'i tshe phyis 'byung ba'i 'bras bu'i shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then the subsequent resultant consciousness that arises would not be produced,

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir la don byed pa'i shes pa ni dngos po dang 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir la don byed pa'i shes pa ni dngos po dang 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be without a cause, and because a consciousness that performs a function is related to an entity.

original: me ma yin pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa las mya ngan 'tshong gi me tog la sogs pa las mer nges pa nyid kyis 'jug pa las btso ba dang sreg pa la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa skye ba ma yin la skye na yang 'di me kho na
analyzed: me ma yin pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa las mya ngan 'tshong gi me tog la sogs pa las mer nges pa nyid kyis 'jug pa las btso ba dang sreg pa la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa skye ba ma yin la skye na yang 'di me kho na
translated: A consciousness apprehending something that is not fire does not engage fire, such as the flower of the mya·πÖgen tree, and so on, and a consciousness appearing as something that is definitely fire does not arise from that.

original: yin no // gang las she na me'i mtshan nyid ni btso ba dang / sreg pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i rgyu nyid tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin no // gang las she na me'i mtshan nyid ni btso ba dang / sreg pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skyed pa'i rgyu nyid tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if it did arise, it would not be ascertained as fire, because it is not the cause of the effect of cooking, burning, and so on.

original: de'i phyir ji srid ces bya ba ni 'di la mjug sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji srid ces bya ba ni 'di la mjug sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúas long as‚Äù is a concluding statement.

analyzed: 'on te don byed pa'i shes pa bzhin du dang po'i shes pa yang me'i dngos pos skyed pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the first consciousness produced by the state of fire, like a consciousness that performs a function?

analyzed: des na ci'i phyir de nyid la tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du dogs kyi phyi ma la ni ma yin zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Then why is it not suspected that it is not a valid knowledge in regard to that, but it is not in regard to the latter?

analyzed: rjes thogs 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, ‚ÄúThe subsequent effect‚Äù and so on is stated.

analyzed: dang po'i shes pa la ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod pa de 'di ltar mjug thogs su btso ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ma byung ba dang / 'khrul pa'i shes pa dang chos mthun pa dang blo mi gsal ba dang / sogs pa'i sgras ma gus pa dang //
translated: The first cognition has a cause of error, because the effect of cooking, etc. does not occur immediately after, and because it is similar to a cognition that is erroneous, and because the mind is unclear, and so on.

original: ma goms pa @236b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: ma goms pa @236b zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes disrespect and lack of practice.

analyzed: 'bras bu'i shes pa la ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang las nges pa yin no //

analyzed: shes pa dang po la yang gang goms pa la sogs pas 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan bsal ba de ni rang nyid las tshad ma nyid yin no zhes ston pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the first cognition is valid knowledge from itself, because the reason for error is removed by practice, etc.,

analyzed: goms pas 'jug na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf it engages through practice,‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: goms pa'i stobs kyis dper na rnal 'byor ba rnams sam /
translated: Through the power of practice, for example, yogins and yoginƒ´s,

analyzed: nor bu dang / de dang 'dra ba la sogs pa la de rig pa rnams 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan thag ring du spangs pa'i rnam par shes pa gsal bar snang ba skye ba yin la /

analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang goms pa'i stobs kyis gsal ba rab tu snang ba nyid kyis 'khrul par dogs pa gsal ba can skye ba na bar ma chod par rigs mthun pa thun mong pa'i rnam par nges pa can gyis rnam par gcod pa'i shes pa skyes

analyzed: pa na de'i yul rigs mi mthun pa las ldog par nges pa'i phyir de rang nyid las tshad ma yin par brjod do //
translated: without interruption, because of the ascertainment of the exclusion of its object from the heterogeneous, it is said that it is valid with regard to itself.

original: gang yang goms pa dang ldan pas 'jug pa na de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtog pa mthong ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa kho na las don thob pa'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tshad ma nyid nges pa'i phyir thams cad du gzhan las tshad ma nyid du
analyzed: gang yang goms pa dang ldan pas 'jug pa na de 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtog pa mthong ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa kho na las don thob pa'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tshad ma nyid nges pa'i phyir thams cad du gzhan las tshad ma nyid du
translated: Also, when one who is familiar with it engages it, because one sees a conception that has such characteristics, one ascertains that it is valid knowledge by the definition of the capacity to obtain the object from inference alone. Therefore, in all cases, it is not the case that valid knowledge is obtained from another.

original: nges par bya'i /
analyzed: nges par bya'i /
translated: When one engages in the object through habituation, one sees a conception that has such characteristics. Therefore, one ascertains the definition of valid knowledge as the capacity to obtain the object from inference alone. Thus, one should ascertain valid knowledge from another source in all cases.

original: la lar rang las nges pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ste /
analyzed: la lar rang las nges pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ste /
translated: One should not ascertain it from itself in some cases.

original: de ni kho bo cag gis ma go ste /
analyzed: de ni kho bo cag gis ma go ste /
translated: We do not understand this.

original: 'di ltar ma 'dres pa'i de dang 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtog pa nges pa nyid gang las byung zhes bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma 'dres pa'i de dang 'dra ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtog pa nges pa nyid gang las byung zhes bya ba brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: We must ask, ‚ÄúHow does the ascertainment of a conception that has such a distinct characteristic arise?‚Äù

original: gal te goms pa las so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te goms pa las so zhe na /
translated: If you say it arises from habituation,

original: gang gi de nyams su myong zhing 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang bral ba na yang ma nges pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba tshad ma nyid la ci zhig snang gzhan yang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te rtog pa'i ngo bo yin na de log
analyzed: gang gi de nyams su myong zhing 'khrul pa'i rgyu dang bral ba na yang ma nges pa zhes bya bar 'gyur ba tshad ma nyid la ci zhig snang gzhan yang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig / gal te rtog pa'i ngo bo yin na de log
translated: But when one experiences that and is free from the cause of error, it is called ‚Äúuncertain.‚Äù What is it that appears to a valid cognition? And what is this ‚Äúsimilarity to another‚Äù?

analyzed: pa'i shes pa la yang yod pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is the nature of a conceptual cognition, then it is not a valid cognition, because it exists even in a mistaken cognition.

original: ci ste dmar po'i rnam par snang ba yin na /üîΩde ni aa sho ka'i me tog la sogs @237a * //
analyzed: ci ste dmar po'i rnam par snang ba yin na / de ni aa sho ka'i me tog la sogs @237a * //
translated: If it is the appearance in the form of red,üîΩthen it exists even in the cognition that apprehends the asoka flower, etc.,

analyzed: de grub par bya ba'i don du rtags gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bar khyed na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yang ci ste rtags kyi rjes su 'brang ba med par yang goms pa'i stobs kho na las de mngon sum gyi rang nyid las grub po snyam na ni de lta na 'on gal te goms pa'i nus pa 'di 'dra bar khas len par byed pa de'i rtags kyi
translated: If you think that without following the evidence, it is established from itself by the power of habituation alone, then in that case, if you accept that such is the power of habituation, then the evidence is pointless.

translated: If that is so, then why did the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, in the context of the LokƒÅyata, say, ‚ÄúHaving observed the engagement of some cognitions that are clear and nondeceptive, in order to avoid error in engaging what is taught,üîΩdirect perception alone is valid cognition, not inference‚Äù?

translated: He said this in order to refute the LokƒÅyata assertion that the definition of direct perception is ‚Äúnonerroneous consciousness‚Äù and that it is limited to just that.

analyzed: ji ltar chos mthun pa mthong ba las ji ltar rab tu bsgrub pa de ni rjes su @237b dpag par bya ba las ma 'das so zhes ji ltar gsungs she na /
translated: He said, ‚ÄúHow can it be that what is established by seeing a similar instance is not beyond inference?‚Äù

analyzed: skyon 'di ni med de rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la 'jug pa'i nyams su myong ba'i yul can gyi blo'i dbang du byas nas 'di gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This fault does not exist because this was said from the perspective of the mind that experiences the object that engages one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô continuums.

analyzed: yul nyams su myong ba las ma gtogs pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it was explained as ‚Äúother than the experience of the object.‚Äù

original: gzhan du gal te 'dra ba las thams cad du tshad ma nyid du khas len par byed na de'i tshe yul nyams su myong ba las ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i dgag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gal te 'dra ba las thams cad du tshad ma nyid du khas len par byed na de'i tshe yul nyams su myong ba las ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i dgag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if one were to accept that all cognitions are valid cognitions, then the negation ‚Äúexcept for the experience of the object‚Äù would be meaningless.

original: de lta bas na goms pa'i stobs las 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid spangs par skye ba gang yin pa der rang nyid las tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de lta bas na goms pa'i stobs las 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid spangs par skye ba gang yin pa der rang nyid las tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that a cognition that arises from the power of habituation, having abandoned the cause of error, is a valid cognition in regard to itself.

original: ji ltar dngos po'i shes pa de ni mi slu ba la ltos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po'i shes pa de ni mi slu ba la ltos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: In regard to what was said, ‚ÄúThe cognition of an object is nondeceptive,‚Äù etc.,

original: rigs mi mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe cognition of an object that is different in kind,‚Äù etc.

original: gang la tshad ma nyid du nyams su myong ba yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu srid pa'i phyir nges par mi nus pa der ni don byed par snang ba'i shes pa gzhan las nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la tshad ma nyid du nyams su myong ba yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu srid pa'i phyir nges par mi nus pa der ni don byed par snang ba'i shes pa gzhan las nges pa yin te /
translated: In regard to that which is not able to ascertain the validity of a cognition because the cause of error is possible, it is ascertained from another cognition that appears to perform a function.

original: de tsam nyid kyis skyes bu'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pas re ba chad pa'i phyir mi slu bas kyang mi slu ba gzhan de kho na bzhin du ste dang po'i shes pa bzhin du /üîΩltos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam nyid kyis skyes bu'i mngon par 'dod pa'i don grub pas re ba chad pa'i phyir mi slu bas kyang mi slu ba gzhan de kho na bzhin du ste dang po'i shes pa bzhin du / ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the purpose of a person is accomplished by that alone, it is nondeceptive because it does not deceive by the mere fact that it is not necessary to rely on another subsequent cognition, just like the first cognition.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig rang nyid las //
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig rang nyid las //
translated: If someone says, ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that the first cognition is nondeceptive,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: then in response to that, it is said,

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'on te the tshom med pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du ma nges pa'i don tshad ma'i nus pa can gyis shes pa gang yin pa de rjes su dpag pa bzhin du tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'on te the tshom med pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid du ma nges pa'i don tshad ma'i nus pa can gyis shes pa gang yin pa de rjes su dpag pa bzhin du tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no cause for error.‚ÄùüîΩIf it is said, ‚ÄúIf the object of nondeceptive cognition does not exist, it is not ascertained that it arises only when the object exists, and the object that is the capacity of valid knowledge is not known. Therefore, like inference, it is not valid knowledge,‚Äù

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa don med na mi 'byung bar the tshom za na tshad mar mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mngon sum yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa don med na mi 'byung bar the tshom za na tshad mar mi 'dod pa de bzhin du mngon sum yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then, just as it is doubted that inference arises only when the object exists and it is not asserted to be valid knowledge, in the same way, direct perception would not be valid knowledge.

original: skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: skyon 'di med de /
translated: This error does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa bzhin du mngon sum don med na mi 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ston pa na tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa bzhin du mngon sum don med na mi 'byung ba'i bdag nyid ston pa na tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because, like inference, direct perception is not asserted to be valid knowledge when it reveals an object that does not exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: snang bzhin pa'i don nges par byed pa na ste /
analyzed: snang bzhin pa'i don nges par byed pa na ste /
translated: It is when it ascertains an object that appears.

original: 'di ltar don byed pa don du gnyer ba mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob par byed pa'i phyir tshad mar brjod kyi don gyi yul du skyes bu gtong bar byed pa'am /üîΩskyes bu'i yul du don 'gugs par byed @238a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar don byed pa don du gnyer ba mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob par byed pa'i phyir tshad mar brjod kyi don gyi yul du skyes bu gtong bar byed pa'am / skyes bu'i yul du don 'gugs par byed @238a * //
translated: Thus, it is called valid knowledge because it causes one to obtain the object that one desires and seeks in order to use it.

original: pa ni de thob par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: pa ni de thob par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not cause one to obtain it by sending a person to the object or by summoning the object to the person.

original: 'on kyang skyes bu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyes bu 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: However, it causes the person to engage in the object.

original: skyes bu de yang lag pa nas bzung nas 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu de yang lag pa nas bzung nas 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it does not cause the person to engage in the object by grasping the person by the hand and leading him there.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /üîΩ'jug pa'i yul nye bar ston pa las yin la /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / 'jug pa'i yul nye bar ston pa las yin la /
translated: What then is it?üîΩIt is by revealing the object to which one should engage.

original: nye bar ston pa de yang snang bzhin pa'i don nges par byed pa las yin gyi /
analyzed: nye bar ston pa de yang snang bzhin pa'i don nges par byed pa las yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, that revelation is by ascertaining an object that appears.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not otherwise.

original: gang yang the tshom za ba der gdon mi za bar snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa nges pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang the tshom za ba der gdon mi za bar snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa nges pa yod pa yin te /
translated: And in regard to that which is doubted, there is certainly a definite appearance, for

original: de ma nges na de rnam par dpyod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma nges na de rnam par dpyod pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: if it were not definite, it would not be possible to analyze it.

original: de lta yin dang de tsam gyis mngon sum gyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de tsam gyis mngon sum gyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin la /
translated: If that were so, then the activity of perception would be completely finished with just that,

original: phyis 'byung ba'i don med na mi 'byung la the tshom za bas ni mngon sum gyi bya ba la mi gnod pa'i phyir the tshom yod na yang mngon sum tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i don med na mi 'byung la the tshom za bas ni mngon sum gyi bya ba la mi gnod pa'i phyir the tshom yod na yang mngon sum tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: and later on, even if there were doubt, it would not be a hindrance to the activity of perception, because the occurrence of doubt does not occur without the non-existence of the object that has arisen, and so perception would be a valid cognition.

original: gang yang snang ba'i dngos po dang 'gal ba'i rnam par nges pa dang ldan pa skye ba der ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang snang ba'i dngos po dang 'gal ba'i rnam par nges pa dang ldan pa skye ba der ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: But in regard to that which is produced with a definite appearance that is incompatible with the thing that appears, it is not a valid cognition.

original: de lta ni smig rgyu 'dzin pa'i shes pa rgyu nges pa dang ldan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: de lta ni smig rgyu 'dzin pa'i shes pa rgyu nges pa dang ldan pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like the cognition that apprehends a mirage, which is produced with a definite appearance of water.

original: de ji skad du bshad pa'i tshad ma'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ji skad du bshad pa'i tshad ma'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not have the activity of a valid cognition as it has been explained.

original: gang yang / dung la ser por shes pa dang / nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa de yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang / dung la ser por shes pa dang / nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa de yang tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: the cognition of a conch as yellow and the cognition of the light of a gem as a gem are not valid cognitions.

original: de la don la ji lta ba bzhin snang ba dang nges pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don la ji lta ba bzhin snang ba dang nges pa dag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not appear and ascertain their object as it is.

original: mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ni snang ba'i dbang gis yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa ni snang ba'i dbang gis yin gyi /
translated: Whether or not something is apprehended by direct perception is due to the power of appearance.

original: don la mi slu ba tsam las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don la mi slu ba tsam las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to merely not being deceived with respect to the object.

original: 'di la yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dang gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du snang ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di la yul dang dus dang rang bzhin dang gnas skabs ji lta ba bzhin du snang ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Here, there is no appearance as it is in terms of object, time, nature, and state.

original: yul dang dus dag kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin tha dad du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul dang dus dag kyang dngos po'i rang bzhin tha dad du byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because object and time are what distinguish the nature of things.

original: yul dang dus de nyid du 'gyur ba de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul dang dus de nyid du 'gyur ba de ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not the same in terms of object and time.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa'i tha snyad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa'i tha snyad rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, the convention of difference would be interrupted.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyi spyi'i yul can yin pas dngos po mi snang ba'i dbang gis dngos po'i yul can du rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa nyid kyi spyi'i yul can yin pas dngos po mi snang ba'i dbang gis dngos po'i yul can du rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Inference is by nature conceptual, and it has a universal for its object. Therefore, it is not posited as having a thing for its object because of the appearance of a thing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: nges pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: nges pa'i dbang gis te /
translated: It is because of ascertainment.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: nges pa rnams kyi ma nges gang //
analyzed: nges pa rnams kyi ma nges gang //
translated: What is uncertain for the certain ones

original: de ni de dag ji ltar yul //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩde lta yin dang rjes su dpag pa ni der snang bas @238b stong yang med na mi 'byung ba'i don mthong ba'i stobs kyis skyed pa'i phyir brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel pas tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de la med na mi 'byung
analyzed: de ni de dag ji ltar yul // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // de lta yin dang rjes su dpag pa ni der snang bas @238b stong yang med na mi 'byung ba'i don mthong ba'i stobs kyis skyed pa'i phyir brgyud nas dngos po dang 'brel pas tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de la med na mi 'byung
translated: How can that be their object?

original: ba nges pa la ltos par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ba nges pa la ltos par bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, although inference is empty of the appearance of that, it is generated by the power of seeing the meaning that is invariably concomitant with it. Therefore, because it is indirectly related to a thing, it is valid knowledge. Thus, it must definitely rely on the ascertainment of the invariable relation.

original: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mngon sum dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rjes su dpag pa skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa mngon sum dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: If that were not so, then it would be impossible for inference to arise, and therefore inference would not be similar to perception.

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa de //
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa de //
translated: Or is it the consciousness?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyis gzhan la tshad ma nyid yin na phan tshun bsnyen pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyis gzhan la tshad ma nyid yin na phan tshun bsnyen pa nyid du ston pa yin te /
translated: If one is valid cognition in regard to the other, then they are mutually dependent, as stated in the verse.

original: 'di ltar rtog pa sngon du gtang ba rnams tshad ma nyid du nges pa la 'jug la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa sngon du gtang ba rnams tshad ma nyid du nges pa la 'jug la /
translated: Thus, those who are inclined to doubt enter into the ascertainment of valid cognition.

original: 'jug pa na yang tshad ma nyid du nges pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pas ji ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa 'dod pa'i don ma nges pa na 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa na yang tshad ma nyid du nges pa'i phyir phan tshun bsten pas ji ltar rtog pa dang ldan pa 'dod pa'i don ma nges pa na 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And when they have entered, they are ascertained as valid cognition. So how can they be mutually dependent? If one who has doubt about the object to be attained enters, then how can he be one who has doubt?

original: brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: brjod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to this is stated in the verse beginning with ‚Äúbecause of the expression.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of entry:

original: don byed pa'i don can dang / tshad mar nges pa'i don can no //
analyzed: don byed pa'i don can dang / tshad mar nges pa'i don can no //
translated: entry with the aim of accomplishing the object and entry with the aim of ascertaining valid cognition.

original: de 'jug pa dang po'i the tshom yod na yang ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar bstan zin te /
analyzed: de 'jug pa dang po'i the tshom yod na yang ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar bstan zin te /
translated: It has already been explained how the first kind of entry occurs even when there is doubt.

original: mngon sum mi snang bar nges par byed pa tsam nyid kyis 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum mi snang bar nges par byed pa tsam nyid kyis 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is entry by mere ascertainment that perception does not appear.

original: des na de lta na rtog pa dang ldan pa nyams par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na de lta na rtog pa dang ldan pa nyams par thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, in that case, it is not the case that the one who has conceptual thought is impaired.

original: don de la the tshom za bas kyang zhing pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: don de la the tshom za bas kyang zhing pa la sogs pa bzhin du 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Because one sees that even when one has doubt about the object, one engages in it, like a farmer, etc.

original: rtog pa sngon du btang bas zhing pa la sogs pa thabs nges pas 'jug go zhes kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa sngon du btang bas zhing pa la sogs pa thabs nges pas 'jug go zhes kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: One cannot say that the farmer, etc., engage by means of a definite method, since conceptual thought precedes it.

original: thabs ni thabs las byung ba la ltos pa'i phyir thabs byung ba ma nges par de nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs ni thabs las byung ba la ltos pa'i phyir thabs byung ba ma nges par de nges pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the method is dependent on the result of the method, if the result of the method is indefinite, it is not possible that it is definite.

original: 'jug pa gnyis pa la yang de tshad ma nyid du the tshom za ba yod na yang ches rigs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug pa gnyis pa la yang de tshad ma nyid du the tshom za ba yod na yang ches rigs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is also very reasonable for the second engagement to have doubt about the validity of the valid cognition, it is said:

original: gang la de yi tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: gang la de yi tshad ma nyid //
translated: When there is doubt about the validity of that,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: gang las gang gi phyir de tshad ma nyid du nges pa la the tshom gyis 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bu des thabs nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang las gang gi phyir de tshad ma nyid du nges pa la the tshom gyis 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir skyes bu des thabs nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because of that, the person who is engaged by doubt as to whether or not that is valid knowledge, that person is not certain about the method.

original: de lta na thabs kyi yul la the tshom med pa'i phyir 'jug par rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta na thabs kyi yul la the tshom med pa'i phyir 'jug par rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, it is reasonable that one should engage in it because one is without doubt about the object of the method.

original: ji ltar der thabs de nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar der thabs de nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is that method certain?

original: de ltar the tshom gyis 'jug kyang //
analyzed: de ltar the tshom gyis 'jug kyang //
translated: Even though one engages in it by doubt,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: tshad ma nyid @239a * //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid @239a * //
translated: The valid cognition itselfüîΩis certain.

original: yang the tshom gyis 'jug na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang the tshom gyis 'jug na yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though one engages in it by doubt, the valid cognition itself is certain.

original: lhag ma ni go bar sla ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bar sla ba'i phyir rnam par ma phye'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and so is not explained.

original: don byed snang ba'i shes pa ni //
analyzed: don byed snang ba'i shes pa ni //
translated: The cognition that appears to perform a functionüîΩand so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag don byed pa'i shes pa las tshad ma nyid du nges pa ma nges nyid du bstan pa'i phyir thug pa med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan dag don byed pa'i shes pa las tshad ma nyid du nges pa ma nges nyid du bstan pa'i phyir thug pa med pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Others teach that the certainty of valid cognition is not certain from a cognition that performs a function, and so they prove that it is endless.

original: de yi rgyu ni dngos po yang //
analyzed: de yi rgyu ni dngos po yang //
translated: The cause of that is also a thing.

original: zhes bya ba ni don byed par shes pa'i rgyu ste ci'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don byed par shes pa'i rgyu ste ci'i phyir tshad ma nyid ma yin zhes 'brel to //
translated: This is the reason for knowing that it is a functional thing. The question is, ‚ÄúWhy is it not a valid cognition?‚Äù

original: de min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to that is stated by ‚ÄúIt is not that . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: re zhig gal te phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa la rtsod pa byed na de ma grub po zhes tshigs su bcad pa dang pos bstan te /
analyzed: re zhig gal te phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i sangs rgyas pa la rtsod pa byed na de ma grub po zhes tshigs su bcad pa dang pos bstan te /
translated: If one argues with the Buddhist who asserts external objects, then that is not established. This is stated by the first verse.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba des don la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba des don la mi slu ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid du 'dod kyi /
translated: Thus the one who asserts external objects asserts that it is a valid cognition because it is nondeceptive with respect to the object.

original: don byed pa'i shes pa la mi slu ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don byed pa'i shes pa la mi slu ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it is nondeceptive with respect to the consciousness that is a functional thing.

original: rmi lam la don la mi slu ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam la don la mi slu ba yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, in a dream, there is no nondeceptiveness with respect to the object.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs thams cad 'khrul pa nyid du thams cad la rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs thams cad 'khrul pa nyid du thams cad la rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because everyone agrees that all instances of dreaming are mistaken.

original: der shes pa thams cad don med pa kho nar skye ba'i phyir yul med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: der shes pa thams cad don med pa kho nar skye ba'i phyir yul med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because all consciousnesses arise there only as meaningless, there is no object.

original: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs na 'byung ba'i shes pa la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs na 'byung ba'i shes pa la tshad ma'i mtshan nyid 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the definition of valid knowledge applies to the consciousnesses that occur in the waking state,

original: gzhan gyis 'khrul pa mi rigs so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'khrul pa mi rigs so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: it is not reasonable for others to be confused.

translated: Who is the one who is harmed by the pitch of the sound and so on, or who does something else?üîΩWho is the one who cuts off what is not a word and makes it into a word?

original: rig byed 'don par byed pa nyon mongs de ji ltar rig byed gus par mi 'don /
analyzed: rig byed 'don par byed pa nyon mongs de ji ltar rig byed gus par mi 'don /
translated: When there is such a search for an opportunity to engage in such effort, how could the one who recites the Veda, being afflicted, not recite the Veda with respect?

original: de lta yin dang rig byed 'di la tshad ma yin pa nyid kyis dogs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rig byed 'di la tshad ma yin pa nyid kyis dogs med pa'i phyir /
