original: de na skyon med pas byas dang // bshad pa nyid du nges 'dod kyis //
analyzed: de na skyon med pas byas dang // bshad pa nyid du nges 'dod kyis //
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the Veda is to be explained by one who is faultless.

original: ci'i phyir brjod snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir brjod snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thinking, Why is it said?

original: de bzhin du gal te rig byed 'don pa dag pa'i blo can rnams kyang gzhan gyi rig byed bshig pa na snyom las te le lo las mi smra ba de'i tshe cha byad tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir rig byed 'di gzhan nyid du srid pa yin no //üîΩgang gi phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te rig byed 'don pa dag pa'i blo can rnams kyang gzhan gyi rig byed bshig pa na snyom las te le lo las mi smra ba de'i tshe cha byad tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir rig byed 'di gzhan nyid du srid pa yin no // gang gi phyir /
translated: Likewise, if the intelligent ones who recite the Vedas are lazy and do not speak when others destroy the Vedas, then at that time the Vedas would become mere conventions. Therefore it is possible that the Vedas are other.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i rig byed 'jig pa'i skyes bu rnams nyams par byed pa ste ldog par byed pa'i blo rnam par dag pa rnams kyis rig byed 'di rtag tu srung bar byed pa'i phyir de ji ltar bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin spong
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i rig byed 'jig pa'i skyes bu rnams nyams par byed pa ste ldog par byed pa'i blo rnam par dag pa rnams kyis rig byed 'di rtag tu srung bar byed pa'i phyir de ji ltar bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin spong
translated: Because those who have minds that are pure and who destroy the Vedas of those who have minds full of attachment and so on, those who have pure minds that stop and destroy the Vedas, always protect the Vedas, how could they abandon their own nature?

original: bar byed / 'di snyam du gal te yang de dag gis rig byed rtag tu bsrungs pa de lta na yang 'jigs pa chen por 'di 'chad pa na phyis rnam pa gzhan du yang srid pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu @253a * //
analyzed: bar byed / 'di snyam du gal te yang de dag gis rig byed rtag tu bsrungs pa de lta na yang 'jigs pa chen por 'di 'chad pa na phyis rnam pa gzhan du yang srid pa yin no snyam du dogs pa bsu @253a * //
translated: If you think that even though they always protect the Vedas, when they are explained to be great fear, it is possible that later they will become otherwise, you are wrong.

original: nas ; 'gro ba thams cad nam du yang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: nas ; 'gro ba thams cad nam du yang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and all beings are neverüîΩThis is the way it is.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te //
translated: The reply is: It is not so,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: and so on.

original: de lta na 'don pa tsam 'ba' zhig mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa yin gyi don rtogs pa'i thabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'don pa tsam 'ba' zhig mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa yin gyi don rtogs pa'i thabs ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, it is only the mere recitation that is shown to be the same, but it is not the means of understanding the meaning.

original: de lta yin dang de'i don du gdon mi za bar 'di skyon med pas byas pa dang bshad pa nyid du 'dod par bya ba nyid do //üîΩ'dod pa tsam gyis nyam chung ba ma mthong ba tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de'i don du gdon mi za bar 'di skyon med pas byas pa dang bshad pa nyid du 'dod par bya ba nyid do // 'dod pa tsam gyis nyam chung ba ma mthong ba tsam gyis thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas /
translated: If that were the case, then for that purpose, one would have to accept that it was composed and explained without fault.

original: yul la sogs pa thams cad du nges par nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni //
analyzed: yul la sogs pa thams cad du nges par nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni //
translated: One is not omniscient just because one is seen to be weak in mere desire, and one is not able to ascertain all objects and so on.üîΩThis is explained:

original: gang gis mngon sum mkhyen pa la //
analyzed: gang gis mngon sum mkhyen pa la //
translated: By whom is it known through direct perception?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di nyid la 'thad par 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid la 'thad par 'chad pa ni /
translated: This is explained as reasonable:

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Otherwise, and so on.

original: gal te 'don pa mtshungs pa de nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe yul la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa la skyes bu rnams kyi blo mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: gal te 'don pa mtshungs pa de nyid du 'gyur na de'i tshe yul la sogs pa 'ga' zhig tu 'don pa la skyes bu rnams kyi blo mi mthun pa ste /
translated: If the recitation were the same, then people would not have different opinions about the recitation in different places.

original: the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩ'gro ba thams cad nam du yang //
analyzed: the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ro // 'gro ba thams cad nam du yang //
translated: They would not have doubts.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩrtag tu 'gro ba 'di 'dra ba //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / rtag tu 'gro ba 'di 'dra ba //
translated: In the passage beginning ‚ÄúAt no time is there a world without beings,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the word ‚Äúalways‚Äù should be supplied.üîΩThe passage should read: ‚ÄúAt all times, the world is just as it is now.‚Äù

original: 'gro ba ni thams cad kyi tshe 'gro ba 'di 'dra ba kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni thams cad kyi tshe 'gro ba 'di 'dra ba kho na'o zhes bya ba 'di la sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no evidence at all for the statement that ‚Äúat all times, the world is just as it is now.‚Äù

original: gang yang sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis //üîΩ'jig pa'i bskal ba dmyal ba yi //
analyzed: gang yang sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis // 'jig pa'i bskal ba dmyal ba yi //
translated: The Buddhists say:

original: srid pa med na gnod zad pa //üîΩzhes 'jig pa'i bskal ba brjod pa dang / gang dran par byed pa rnams kyis //
analyzed: srid pa med na gnod zad pa // zhes 'jig pa'i bskal ba brjod pa dang / gang dran par byed pa rnams kyis //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the eon of destruction, there are no beings in the hells.üîΩWhen the harm is exhausted, the eon of destruction is finished.‚Äù

original: 'di ni kun nas mun par gyur //üîΩnges pa ma yin mtshon pa min //
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas mun par gyur // nges pa ma yin mtshon pa min //
translated: They also say: ‚ÄúIn the eon of destruction, the world is completely dark.üîΩIt is not definite, it is not a weapon,

original: brtag bya ma yin shes bya min //
analyzed: brtag bya ma yin shes bya min //
translated: it is not an object of investigation, it is not an object of knowledge.‚Äù

original: gnyid stug lta bur gyur pa yin //
analyzed: gnyid stug lta bur gyur pa yin //
translated: It is like deep sleep.

original: zhes brjod pa'i 'jig pa 'di gnyi ga la yang /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa'i 'jig pa 'di gnyi ga la yang /
translated: In both of these two types of destruction,

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na gang gis thams cad kyi tshe /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin na gang gis thams cad kyi tshe /
translated: there is not the slightest valid cognition that contradicts them.

original: 'gro ba 'di 'dra ba nyid du grub par gyur pa yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di 'dra ba nyid du grub par gyur pa yin /
translated: So how could it be established that all things are like this?

original: ma mthong tsam gyis dngos po rnams med pa nyid du grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong tsam gyis dngos po rnams med pa nyid du grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that things are established as nonexistent merely because they are not seen,

original: dngos po yod pa nyid na yang la lar mi mthong ba'i phyir dngos po med pas ma mthong ba tsam la khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa nyid na yang la lar mi mthong ba'i phyir dngos po med pas ma mthong ba tsam la khyab pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even when things exist, sometimes they are not seen. Mere nonseeing does not entail the nonexistence of things.

original: gzhan yang rtag tu rang gi don @253b dang rang bzhin gyi yul can gyi nges pa skye ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag tu rang gi don @253b dang rang bzhin gyi yul can gyi nges pa skye ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, a permanent, intrinsic, and objective certainty arises,

original: rig byed rang las tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir sgo nas rmongs pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir dang rang bzhin du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed rang las tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir sgo nas rmongs pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir dang rang bzhin du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Vedas are valid cognitions by themselves, because they are not confused, because they are permanent, and because they cannot be made intrinsic.

original: khyed cag gi lugs kyis rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang 'jig pa mi srid pas de'i phyir rig byed 'don par byed pa rnams kyis 'di srung bar byed pa 'bras bu med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston pa ni /üîΩrang las tshad ma nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyed cag gi lugs kyis rnam pa gnyi ga ltar yang 'jig pa mi srid pas de'i phyir rig byed 'don par byed pa rnams kyis 'di srung bar byed pa 'bras bu med pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ston pa ni / rang las tshad ma nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,

original: gnyis skyes phru gu ni bram ze'i byis pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis skyes phru gu ni bram ze'i byis pa'o //
translated: The child of the twice-born is the son of a Brahmin.

original: de ltar re zhig rang las tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir 'di'i 'jig pa mi srid do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rang las tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir 'di'i 'jig pa mi srid do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, it has been demonstrated that the destruction of the Vedas is impossible because they are not valid cognitions in themselves.

original: da ni rtag pa'i phyir mi srid do zhes bya ba 'di bstan par 'dod nas 'dri ba ni /
analyzed: da ni rtag pa'i phyir mi srid do zhes bya ba 'di bstan par 'dod nas 'dri ba ni /
translated: Now, wishing to demonstrate that destruction is impossible because the Vedas are permanent, he asks,

original: rdo rje bas lhag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bas lhag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Is the vajra stronger than the child of the twice-born?

original: mngon gsal gzhan nyid yin zhe na //
analyzed: mngon gsal gzhan nyid yin zhe na //
translated: If you say manifestation is different,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa ni zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa ni zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: this is to be connected with ‚Äúthe destruction of the Vedas.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni mngon par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni mngon par gsal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to manifestation.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the Vedas.

original: de'i phyir dbang 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Therefore, he concludes with ‚ÄúTherefore, the Vedas are not authoritative, etc.‚Äù

original: nang gi mun pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi mun pa ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúInner darkness‚Äù is afflicted and unafflicted ignorance.

original: de'i tshogs ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshogs ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIts collection‚Äù is its assembly.

original: de gang gis rnam par gsal ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de gang gis rnam par gsal ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which illuminates it‚Äù is the Buddha.

original: dam bca' ba'i don thams cad rnam dbye shes pa ni 'chad pa /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'i don thams cad rnam dbye shes pa ni 'chad pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of all the theses‚Äù is the meaning of all the statements of the proponents of the Vedas.üîΩ‚ÄúThe knower of the categories‚Äù is the expounder.üîΩ‚ÄúThe agent‚Äù is the one who composes the treatises.

original: byed pa po zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyis zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: byed pa po zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyis zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who is called‚Äù is the one who is known as.

original: de lta bas na de ltar dam bca' ba'i don thams cad du tshad mas gnod pa nyid dang de yod na yod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di yang ma nges pa nyid du bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar dam bca' ba'i don thams cad du tshad mas gnod pa nyid dang de yod na yod pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di yang ma nges pa nyid du bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the meaning of all the theses is contradicted by validating cognition, and since that is so, this reason, ‚Äúbecause of existing when that exists,‚Äù is also established as being indefinite.

original: rang gi phyogs grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid ni gang zhig the tshom dang phyin ci log gi yul du byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs grub par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid ni gang zhig the tshom dang phyin ci log gi yul du byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: The condensed meaning is this: in order to establish one‚Äôs own position, one should not take valid cognition as the object of doubt and error.

original: gang yang phyogs bzhi bkod nas phyogs gsum pa la skyon brjod par byas pa de la yang sangs rgyas pa la nyams pa cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bzhi bkod nas phyogs gsum pa la skyon brjod par byas pa de la yang sangs rgyas pa la nyams pa cung zad kyang med de /
translated: Moreover, even if one sets forth the four positions and then accuses the third position of error, the Buddhist has not the slightest fault.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis bzhi po 'di dag las gang rung ba gcig 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis bzhi po 'di dag las gang rung ba gcig 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is because the Buddhists do not assert any one of these four,

original: nges pa med pa'i phyogs 'dod pa nyid kyi @254a * //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyogs 'dod pa nyid kyi @254a * //
translated: because they assert the position of indeterminacy.

original: phyir ro // 'di ltar cung zad cig ni rang las yin la cung zad cig ni gzhan las yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnyi ga yang sngar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir ro // 'di ltar cung zad cig ni rang las yin la cung zad cig ni gzhan las yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnyi ga yang sngar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus both of these, that some things arise from self and some things arise from other, were previously stated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyogs bzhi nye bar bkod pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyogs bzhi nye bar bkod pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is also illogical to set forth the four positions.

original: phyogs lnga pa nges pa med pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs lnga pa nges pa med pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is also a fifth position, namely, that it is indeterminate.

original: gzhan dag gis dam bca' ba'i don rnams gzhan du yang rjod par byed de //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis dam bca' ba'i don rnams gzhan du yang rjod par byed de //
translated: Others express the meaning of the thesis in a different way:

original: rtog pa'i byed pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: rtog pa'i byed pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: The nature of the instrument of knowledge is that it is the apprehender.

original: de yang shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin kho na yin gyi yon tan gyis khyab pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin kho na yin gyi yon tan gyis khyab pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of consciousness itself, not the quality of consciousness.

original: yon tan med na yang phyin ci log gi shes pa la rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan med na yang phyin ci log gi shes pa la rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when there is no quality, there is the nature of apprehension in erroneous consciousness.

original: de'i phyir rang las tshad ma nyid //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang las tshad ma nyid // ces bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the instrument of knowledge is not due to the quality.üîΩThe nature of the instrument of knowledge is not due to the quality.

original: yon tan rnams kyis ni skyon sel ba kho na byas pas des de spang bar bya ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid ni yon tan la ltos kyi bdag nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yon tan rnams kyis ni skyon sel ba kho na byas pas des de spang bar bya ba'i phyir tshad ma nyid ni yon tan la ltos kyi bdag nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin no zhes de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: The quality merely removes the fault, and the instrument of knowledge is due to the quality in order to remove that fault, not in order to attain its own nature. This is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kho na tshad ma nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kho na tshad ma nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the nature of the instrument of knowledge is not reasonable as merely the nature of apprehension.

original: phyin ci log gi shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it also exists in erroneous consciousnesses.

original: rtags pa'i khyad par tshad ma nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rtags pa'i khyad par tshad ma nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the specific awareness is valid knowledge,

original: 'o na de yang shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin kho na yin gyi yon tan gyis byas pa ni ma yin te yon tan med pa yang phyin ci log gi shes pa la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'o na de yang shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin kho na yin gyi yon tan gyis byas pa ni ma yin te yon tan med pa yang phyin ci log gi shes pa la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: then you should not say that it is the nature of consciousnesses alone and not produced by qualities, because even that which lacks qualities exists in erroneous consciousnesses.

original: 'di ltar gal te rtogs pa'i khyad par tshad ma nyid du 'dod par gyur na de'i tshe de nyid yon tan gyis byas pa nyid yin na 'khrul par bstan par rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rtogs pa'i khyad par tshad ma nyid du 'dod par gyur na de'i tshe de nyid yon tan gyis byas pa nyid yin na 'khrul par bstan par rigs kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: If you accept that the specific awareness is valid knowledge, then it is reasonable to teach that it is produced by qualities, but not otherwise.

original: bzlog pa'i shes pa la yang bzlog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs pa'i khyad par yon tan gyis byas pa nyid yin na 'khrul par bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i shes pa la yang bzlog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dis rtogs pa'i khyad par yon tan gyis byas pa nyid yin na 'khrul par bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And this statement ‚ÄúBecause it is reversed in the case of a reversed consciousness‚Äù does not teach that the specific awareness is produced by qualities and is erroneous.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What does it teach?

original: rtogs pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i spyi'o //
translated: It teaches the general nature of awareness.

original: gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i spyi ni yon tan gyis byas par 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rtogs pa'i spyi ni yon tan gyis byas par 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is the generality that is understood by others asserted to be produced by the qualities.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: rtogs pa'i khyad par ro //üîΩyon tan gyis byas pa nyid yin na 'khrul par bstan par nus pa yang ma yin la gang gis de bkag pas khyed cag gi rang las yin pa rnam par gzhag pa kho bo cag gi yon @254b tan gyis byas pa nyid kyis gzhan las tshad ma nyid
analyzed: rtogs pa'i khyad par ro // yon tan gyis byas pa nyid yin na 'khrul par bstan par nus pa yang ma yin la gang gis de bkag pas khyed cag gi rang las yin pa rnam par gzhag pa kho bo cag gi yon @254b tan gyis byas pa nyid kyis gzhan las tshad ma nyid
translated: It is a particular understanding.üîΩIf it were produced by the qualities, it could not be taught to be mistaken, and since it is refuted by that, we do not assert that valid knowledge is produced from other, as you do, by positing it as produced from itself.

original: du 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: du 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: We do not assert that valid knowledge is produced from other.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: la lar rtogs pa'i khyad par 'di nyams su myong yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du nges pa skyed par mi byed pas gzhan las de nges par byed pa'i phyir gzhan las shes pa rnam par bzhag go //
analyzed: la lar rtogs pa'i khyad par 'di nyams su myong yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du nges pa skyed par mi byed pas gzhan las de nges par byed pa'i phyir gzhan las shes pa rnam par bzhag go //
translated: Although this particular understanding is experienced in some cases, it does not generate ascertainment exactly as it is experienced because there are reasons for error. Therefore, since it ascertains from other, knowledge is posited as produced from other.

original: gzhan yang rtog pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba tshad ma nyid yin pa la yang brtag par nus pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang rtog pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba tshad ma nyid yin pa la yang brtag par nus pa kho na yin la /
translated: Moreover, the statement ‚Äúthat which has the nature of conceptualization‚Äù is capable of being analyzed as to whether it is valid cognition.

original: de yang shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi skyon gyis byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang shes pa rnams kyi rang bzhin gyi skyon gyis byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: And that is not due to the fault in the nature of consciousnesses,

original: skyon med na'ang yang dag pa'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba /üîΩrang las tshad ma ma yin nyid //
analyzed: skyon med na'ang yang dag pa'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba / rang las tshad ma ma yin nyid //
translated: because even when there is no fault, there is correct knowledge.

original: ces bya la /
analyzed: ces bya la /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not valid cognition by itself‚Äù is as follows.

original: skyon rnams kyis ni yon tan sel bar nyid byed de /
analyzed: skyon rnams kyis ni yon tan sel bar nyid byed de /
translated: The faults themselves eliminate the virtues.

original: des na gsal ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid ni skyon la ltos kyi //
analyzed: des na gsal ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid ni skyon la ltos kyi //
translated: Therefore, because of that, the non-validity of valid cognition does not depend on the faults,

original: bdag nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin pa de lta bas 'di ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ni ma yin pa de lta bas 'di ni gyi na'o //
translated: but it does depend on the attainment of its own nature. Thus this is mere quibbling.

original: au ma pe ka na re rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba shes pa rnams kyi tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: au ma pe ka na re rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba shes pa rnams kyi tshad ma nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: UmƒÅpeika says, ‚ÄúThat which has the nature of conceptualization‚Äù is not valid cognition of consciousnesses.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: don la mi slu ba nyid de 'di ltar rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yod na yang gang la don la mi slu ba nyid med pa de ni tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don la mi slu ba nyid de 'di ltar rtogs pa'i bdag nyid yod na yang gang la don la mi slu ba nyid med pa de ni tshad ma nyid ma yin te /
translated: In reality, it is nondeceptive, because if it has the nature of realization, then it is valid knowledge, even though it is not nondeceptive with regard to its object.

original: dper na nya phyis la dngul gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nya phyis la dngul gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a cognition of silver with regard to a shell is valid knowledge, even though it is not nondeceptive with regard to its object.

original: gang la rtogs pa'i bdag nyid med na yang don la mi slu ba nyid yod pa de ni tshad ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang la rtogs pa'i bdag nyid med na yang don la mi slu ba nyid yod pa de ni tshad ma nyid yin te /
translated: But if it does not have the nature of realization, then it is valid knowledge, even though it is nondeceptive with regard to its object.

original: dper na me la du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me la du ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, smoke is valid knowledge with regard to fire, even though it is not nondeceptive with regard to its object.

original: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mi slu ba nyid tshad ma nyid du grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mi slu ba nyid tshad ma nyid du grub po //
translated: Therefore, nondeceptiveness is established as valid knowledge by positive and negative concomitance.

original: de yang shes pa rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyu las nye bar skye ba'i tshogs pa gzhan las ni ma yin pa des na de'i phyir tshad ma rnams rang las tshad ma nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: de yang shes pa rnams kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyu las nye bar skye ba'i tshogs pa gzhan las ni ma yin pa des na de'i phyir tshad ma rnams rang las tshad ma nyid du brjod do //
translated: Moreover, it is not produced from another assemblage of causes that is the nature of cognition. Therefore, valid knowledge is said to be valid knowledge by itself.

original: rang gi sgra ni bdag gis brjod pa'i phyir de bdag nyid kyi rgyu las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi sgra ni bdag gis brjod pa'i phyir de bdag nyid kyi rgyu las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù means that it is produced from a cause that is itself.

original: rang nyid byed par nus pa ni //
analyzed: rang nyid byed par nus pa ni //
translated: And you are able to do it,üîΩ

original: gzhan gyis bya bar nus ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bya bar nus ma yin //
translated: It is not possible for another to do what is possible for itself.

original: zhes bya ba phyed phyi mas tshogs pa gzhan las byung ba bkag pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba phyed phyi mas tshogs pa gzhan las byung ba bkag pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The second half of the verse shows that the arising from another assemblage is refuted.

original: rang las bya bar mi nus na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa gzhan mi rtogs pa gzhan gyis nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang las bya bar mi nus na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa gzhan mi rtogs pa gzhan gyis nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is not possible for it to do what is possible for itself, then it is not possible for another cognition to do what is possible for another assemblage of cognitions. This is the meaning.

original: 'di snyam du rnam par @255a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du rnam par @255a * //
translated: If you think thus:

original: shes pa'i rgyu gzhan rnams ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i thun mong ba yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rgyu gzhan rnams ni tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i thun mong ba yin te /
translated: The other causes of cognition are common to valid cognition and invalid cognition.

original: de ji ltar rgyu tsam du gnas pa na tshad ma nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar rgyu tsam du gnas pa na tshad ma nyid du 'gyur /
translated: How can it be valid cognition when it is merely a cause?

original: de lta bas na tshad ma nyid ni tshogs pa gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba yin gyi shes pa tsam gyis bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad ma nyid ni tshogs pa gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba yin gyi shes pa tsam gyis bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, valid cognition is produced by another assemblage, not by mere cognition.

original: tshogs par gzhan de yang yon tan dang ldan pa gcig pa nyid kyis dbang po la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshogs par gzhan de yang yon tan dang ldan pa gcig pa nyid kyis dbang po la sogs pa yin te /
translated: That other assemblage is the sense faculty, etc., because they are the unique possessors of the qualities.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dbang po la sogs yon tan dag /'di'i rgyu yin zhes bshad pa bzhin nom //üîΩsgra las yang yid ches par byas pa nyid rgyu'i yon tan gyi tha snyad nges pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs yon tan dag /'di'i rgyu yin zhes bshad pa bzhin nom // sgra las yang yid ches par byas pa nyid rgyu'i yon tan gyi tha snyad nges pa yin la /
translated: It is just as in the statement, ‚ÄúThe qualities such as the sense faculties are the causes of this.‚ÄùüîΩIf you think that the mere fact that the Vedas are accepted as authoritative is the ascertainment of the conventional term ‚Äúauthoritative‚Äù because of a cause,

original: rig byed la yang de med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rig byed la yang de med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: then it follows that the Vedas are not authoritative because they do not have that.

original: skyon 'di ni med de tshogs pa gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon 'di ni med de tshogs pa gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This error does not exist because it is established that they are produced by another collection.

original: gang gi phyir yon tan rnams sgrub pa'i sgo nas tshad ma zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu bskyed pa la bya ba rtogs pa srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yon tan rnams sgrub pa'i sgo nas tshad ma zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu bskyed pa la bya ba rtogs pa srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to understand the activity of the so-called authoritative cause that produces the effect in terms of establishing the qualities.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo kho na gzhan la ltos pa med par don la mi slu ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo kho na gzhan la ltos pa med par don la mi slu ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: The nature of the sense faculties and so on is that they produce a nondeceptive consciousness of the object without relying on anything else.

original: mig sman la sogs pa rnams ni skyon dang bral bar byed pa la bya ba dang ldan pa yin gyi yon tan byed pa ni ma yin no //üîΩci ste yang dbang po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tshad ma ma yin pa'ang yod pas thams cad la tshad ma skyed par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig sman la sogs pa rnams ni skyon dang bral bar byed pa la bya ba dang ldan pa yin gyi yon tan byed pa ni ma yin no // ci ste yang dbang po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo las tshad ma ma yin pa'ang yod pas thams cad la tshad ma skyed par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Eye medicine and so on are not causes of the qualities of eyes and so on, but they are causes of the removal of the faults of eyes and so on.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir ro snyam na /
translated: But if the eye and so on are not valid cognitions by their own nature, then it follows that all cognitions are valid cognitions, because the cause is not incomplete.

original: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not so.

original: skyon yod na yang tshogs pa gzhan las mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon yod na yang tshogs pa gzhan las mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if there is a fault, a different effect arises from a different collection of causes.

original: 'di snyam du ci'i phyir bzlog pa shes par mi byed /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ci'i phyir bzlog pa shes par mi byed /
translated: Why do you not accept that the opposite is true?

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan la ltos pa med par 'khrul ba'i shes pa skyed par byed la /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid gzhan la ltos pa med par 'khrul ba'i shes pa skyed par byed la /
translated: The eye and so on generate a mistaken consciousness by their own nature, without depending on anything else.

original: yon tan yin na yang tshogs pa gzhan gyi don la mi slu ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yon tan yin na yang tshogs pa gzhan gyi don la mi slu ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: But if they are qualities, they generate a non mistaken consciousness in another collection of causes.

original: 'di ni bden te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te /
translated: This is true.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid tshul gsum pa'i rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa la tshad ma nyid du skyed par byed par mthong bas mngon sum la yang 'dra ba'i phyir de nyid skyed par byed @255b parüîΩbrtag pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid tshul gsum pa'i rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa la tshad ma nyid du skyed par byed par mthong bas mngon sum la yang 'dra ba'i phyir de nyid skyed par byed @255b par brtag pa yin no //
translated: and that the production of consciousness by the eye, etc., is established by inference, etc., as having the three modes, then perception is similar to that, and therefore it is to be considered as a producer of knowledge.

original: phyin ci log gi shes pa'i ngo bo 'bras bu ni dbang po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo las mi skye ba ni tshogs pa gzhan rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi shes pa'i ngo bo 'bras bu ni dbang po la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo las mi skye ba ni tshogs pa gzhan rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The effect of a mistaken consciousness is not produced from the intrinsic reality of the eye, etc., because it is produced from another collection of causes. Therefore it is not a fault.

original: 'di thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: All of this is not without fault.

original: 'di ltar re zhig shes pa'i tshad ma nyid ni don la mi slu ba nyid yin la de'i de yang bdag nyid kyi rgyu la nye bar skye'o zhes gang smras pa 'di grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig shes pa'i tshad ma nyid ni don la mi slu ba nyid yin la de'i de yang bdag nyid kyi rgyu la nye bar skye'o zhes gang smras pa 'di grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Thus, first of all, the validity of knowledge is nondeception with respect to its object, and that is produced from its own cause. This is a proof of what is already established.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: tshad ma slu ba med can gyi //üîΩshes pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi don la mi slu ba nyid ces bya ba shes pa'i tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma slu ba med can gyi // shes pa zhes bshad pa'i phyir kho bo cag gi don la mi slu ba nyid ces bya ba shes pa'i tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa kho na yin la /
translated: Because it is said that valid knowledge is nondeceptive.üîΩTherefore, we maintain that the nondeceptiveness of our object is the valid knowledge of consciousness itself.

original: 'on kyang shes pa zhes khyad par nye bar gzung ba'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i du ba la sogs pa dngos su tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod pa'i phyir de la mi slu ba nyid tsam tshad ma nyid du grub ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa zhes khyad par nye bar gzung ba'i phyir shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i du ba la sogs pa dngos su tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod pa'i phyir de la mi slu ba nyid tsam tshad ma nyid du grub ste /
translated: However, because we specify that it is consciousness, we do not maintain that such things as smoke, which are not the nature of consciousness, are valid knowledge in the direct sense. Therefore, we establish that mere nondeceptiveness is valid knowledge.

original: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i phyir dngos po 'jug pa la shes pa nyid gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blang bar bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i phyir dngos po 'jug pa la shes pa nyid gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because consciousness is primary in engaging objects to be adopted or to be rejected.

original: 'di ltar du ba la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba yin 'ang ji srid du rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa de srid du skyes bu don la 'jug par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar du ba la sogs pa med na mi 'byung ba yin 'ang ji srid du rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa de srid du skyes bu don la 'jug par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, even though such things as smoke are not produced without fire, as long as consciousness is not produced, they do not cause a person to engage in an object.

original: de ltas bas na shes pa ni 'jug pa la bar ma chod pa'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltas bas na shes pa ni 'jug pa la bar ma chod pa'i byed pa po yin pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since consciousness is the uninterrupted agent of engagement, it is itself a valid cognition.üîΩIt is explained:

original: blo ni tshad ma nyid /üîΩblang dang dor bya'i dngos po la //
analyzed: blo ni tshad ma nyid / blang dang dor bya'i dngos po la //
translated: The mind is itself a valid cognition,üîΩBecause it is the principal

original: 'jug pa de gtso nyid phyir ro //üîΩzhes gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa de gtso nyid phyir ro // zhes gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: In engaging the objects to be adopted and to be discarded.

original: mi slu ba nyid kyi shes pa de yang don thob par nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: mi slu ba nyid kyi shes pa de yang don thob par nus pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, that consciousness which is nondeceptive is characterized by the ability to attain the object,

original: don thob pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don thob pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the attainment of the object itself,

original: gegs pa la sogs srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gegs pa la sogs srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because obstacles and so on are possible.üîΩSince the potency of things is their very nature, who would assert that it is produced from another thing?

original: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gang gis de 'gegs par 'gyur ba de don gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa'i su zhig yin te grub pa na ma grub pa'i chos ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa yang ma
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gang gis de 'gegs par 'gyur ba de don gzhan las skye bar 'dod pa'i su zhig yin te grub pa na ma grub pa'i chos ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa yang ma
translated: When something is established, it is not reasonable for an unestablished phenomenon to be its nature,

original: yin te / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: de yang tshad ma'i bdag nyid gyur pa yin na yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bus ma rtogs pas nges par mi nus pa'i phyir don byed pa'i shes par brjod pa'i 'bras bu gzhan las nges par byed do //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma'i bdag nyid gyur pa yin na yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bus ma rtogs pas nges par mi nus pa'i phyir don byed pa'i shes par brjod pa'i 'bras bu gzhan las nges par byed do //
translated: Moreover, even if it is the nature of valid cognition, because the cause of error exists, it is not able to ascertain the object, since it is not understood by the result of that. Therefore, it ascertains the object from another result called ‚Äúthe cognition that performs a function.‚Äù

original: @256a * // des na nges pa la ltos nas gzhan las tshad ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @256a * // des na nges pa la ltos nas gzhan las tshad ma zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, in dependence on ascertainment, valid cognition is said to be from another.

original: skyed par byed pa la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa la ltos nas ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not in dependence on the producer.

original: des na rgyu gzhan las skye ba 'gegs pa don med de /
analyzed: des na rgyu gzhan las skye ba 'gegs pa don med de /
translated: Therefore, it is pointless to refute arising from another cause,

original: rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no dispute.

original: khyed cag gis kyang nus pa nges pa ni gzhan las yin par 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: khyed cag gis kyang nus pa nges pa ni gzhan las yin par 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: You also assert that ascertainment of the potential is from another.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dngos po kun gyi nus pa rnams //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi nus pa rnams //
translated: The potentials of all things

original: 'bras bu'i don gyis grub par byed //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don gyis grub par byed //
translated: are established by the meaning of the effect.

original: ces bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: And:

original: gang yang / rang la med pa'i nus pa ni //
analyzed: gang yang / rang la med pa'i nus pa ni //
translated: The potential that does not exist in itself

original: gzhan gyis bya bar nus ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bya bar nus ma yin //
translated: cannot be produced by another.

original: zhes bya ba 'di tshogs pa gzhan las byung ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di tshogs pa gzhan las byung ba dgag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: This is stated in order to refute arising from another.

original: gtan tshigs brjod pa de ni tshad ma ma yin pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs brjod pa de ni tshad ma ma yin pa la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that reason is similar for a nonvalid cognition.

original: de yang rang nyid las tshad mar thal bar 'gyur la /üîΩyang na de gtan tshigs ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rang nyid las tshad mar thal bar 'gyur la / yang na de gtan tshigs ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it follows that it is a valid cognition in regard to itself.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is not a reason because it is mistaken.

original: gang yang yon tan rnams dang grub pa'i sgo nas tshad ma'i 'bras bu bskyed pa la bya ba rtogs pa srid pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di yang mi gsal ba'i don can long ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: gang yang yon tan rnams dang grub pa'i sgo nas tshad ma'i 'bras bu bskyed pa la bya ba rtogs pa srid pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di yang mi gsal ba'i don can long ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúIt is impossible to realize activity through the generation of the result of valid knowledge by means of qualities and establishment‚Äù is the statement of a blind man with an unclear meaning.

original: bsgrub pa'i sgo nas bya ba rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin pa mi shes te gal te re zhig rig byed kyi ngag 'di bya'o zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba'i phyir blo sngon du gtong ba'i 'jug pa de ni dbang po laüîΩsogs pa la yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i sgo nas bya ba rtogs pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin pa mi shes te gal te re zhig rig byed kyi ngag 'di bya'o zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu bskyed par bya ba'i phyir blo sngon du gtong ba'i 'jug pa de ni dbang po laüîΩsogs pa la yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: We do not understand what this ‚Äúrealization of activity through establishment‚Äù is. If this statement of the Veda, ‚ÄúOne should do this,‚Äù is the engagement of the mind that precedes the generation of the result, then that is not the case for the sense faculties and so on.

original: dngos po thams cad ni skad cig ma nyid kyis g-yo ba dang bya ba dag mi srid pa'i phyir dngos po rnams la rtog pa sngon du gtong ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni skad cig ma nyid kyis g-yo ba dang bya ba dag mi srid pa'i phyir dngos po rnams la rtog pa sngon du gtong ba nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because all things are momentary, movement and action are impossible, and therefore conceptualization does not exist in things.

original: de lta yin dang dbang po la sogs pa la yang sgrub pa'i sgo nas bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dbang po la sogs pa la yang sgrub pa'i sgo nas bya ba mi srid pa'i phyir rgyu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the sense faculties, etc., would be causes because it would be impossible for them to function by way of accomplishment.

original: ci ste skyed par byed pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa med na yang dbang po la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu skyed pa la 'jug pa yin pas rgyu nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: ci ste skyed par byed pa'i bya ba dang ldan pa med na yang dbang po la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyis 'bras bu skyed pa la 'jug pa yin pas rgyu nyid du 'dod la /
translated: But if you maintain that the sense faculties, etc., are causes even though they do not have the action of producing, because the effect is engaged in production by the mere presence of the sense faculties, etc.,

original: 'di ni yon tan dag la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni yon tan dag la yang mtshungs te /
translated: then the same is true of the qualities.

original: rgyu rnams kyis 'bras bu skyed pa la nges par yod pa nye ba las ma gtogs par bya ba gzhan rtogs pa srid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu rnams kyis 'bras bu skyed pa la nges par yod pa nye ba las ma gtogs par bya ba gzhan rtogs pa srid pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible to conceive of any other action of the causes in producing the effect, apart from the mere presence of the causes.

original: ci ste yon tan yod na skyon ldog pa na tshad ma nyed skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la skyon rnams bsgrub pa'i sgo nas tshad ma ma yin par @256b 'jug pa la bya ba byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste yon tan yod na skyon ldog pa na tshad ma nyed skye'o zhes bya ba 'di la skyon rnams bsgrub pa'i sgo nas tshad ma ma yin par @256b 'jug pa la bya ba byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But in this case, the fault does not function to engage the non-valid cognition by way of establishing the faults.

original: de lta yin dang tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang las yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang las yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were the case, then it would follow that the non-valid cognition would be self-established.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be no difference.

original: skyon rnams yon tan ma bsal bar dngos su tshad ma ma yin pa la 'jug pa ni mtshon pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon rnams yon tan ma bsal bar dngos su tshad ma ma yin pa la 'jug pa ni mtshon pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The non-valid cognition does not directly engage the faults without clearing away the good qualities.

original: de lta bas na de yod na yod pa'i rjes su byed pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyon bzhin du yon tan rnams la yang rgyu nyid mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yod na yod pa'i rjes su byed pa las ma gtogs pa gzhan rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po srid pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyon bzhin du yon tan rnams la yang rgyu nyid mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the relation of cause and effect is not possible except for the relation of the existence of one thing when another exists, the good qualities are the same as the faults in being causes.

original: gang yang dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo kho na gzhan la ltos pa med par don la mi slu ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang dbang po la sogs pa'i ngo bo kho na gzhan la ltos pa med par don la mi slu ba'i shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, it is not logical to say that the nature of the sense faculties and so on, without depending on anything else, produces a consciousness that is nondeceptive with regard to its object.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin du shes pa thams cad tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin du shes pa thams cad tshad ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that all consciousnesses would be valid knowledge, just like the nature of the realization of a complete cause.

original: ji ltar shes pa rnams kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang 'brel pa na skyon la sogs pa yod na yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis shes pa thams cad las 'gyur ba bzhin du don la mi slu ba
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa rnams kyi rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang 'brel pa na skyon la sogs pa yod na yang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid kyis shes pa thams cad las 'gyur ba bzhin du don la mi slu ba
translated: Just as the nature of the realization of consciousnesses is that when they are connected to the immediately preceding condition, even if there are faults and so on, all consciousnesses become nondeceptive with regard to their object by virtue of the completeness of their causes.

original: nyid kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyid kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: Nondeceptiveness with regard to its object would also be like that.üîΩIf you think that when faults produce nonvalid cognition, complete causes of valid knowledge do not arise,

original: 'di snyam du skyon rnams kyis tshad ma ma yin pa nyid skyed pa na rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i tshad ma yang nye bar skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du skyon rnams kyis tshad ma ma yin pa nyid skyed pa na rgyu ma tshang ba med pa'i tshad ma yang nye bar skye ba ma yin te /
translated: then it would follow that even when complete causes of nonvalid cognition arise, valid knowledge would not arise.

original: shes pa gcig la tshad ma dang cig shos 'gal ba dag mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa gcig la tshad ma dang cig shos 'gal ba dag mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for a single cognition to have as its object both a valid cognition and its opposite.

original: 'gal ba med pa'i rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni thams cad la yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i rtogs pa'i ngo bo ni thams cad la yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The nature of a cognition that is not contradictory is present in all cases.

original: gal te de lta na dbang po'i ngo bo nyid gzhan la ma ltos pa'i rgyur grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na dbang po'i ngo bo nyid gzhan la ma ltos pa'i rgyur grub pa ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then the nature of the sense faculty is not established as the cause that does not depend on another,

original: de ma tshang ba med pa yin yang tshad mar brjod pa'i 'bras bu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma tshang ba med pa yin yang tshad mar brjod pa'i 'bras bu mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because even when it is complete, the effect that is called valid knowledge does not arise.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa ni rigs 'ga' skyed par byed pa nyid rigs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa ni rigs 'ga' skyed par byed pa nyid rigs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not reasonable that something that does not depend on another is the cause that produces a particular type of effect.

original: gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'byung ba de tsam gyi rgyu can du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod na yang mi 'byung ba de tsam gyi rgyu can du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that something is the cause of just that which does not occur when it is absent,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to an absurd consequence.

original: gzhan yang re zhig khyed cag gis gal te tshad ma nyid du rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin na ci'i phyir skyon yod na yang skyed par mi byed pas bya ba 'di brjod par rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig khyed cag gis gal te tshad ma nyid du rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin na ci'i phyir skyon yod na yang skyed par mi byed pas bya ba 'di brjod par rigs so //
translated: Moreover, you should explain this: if the cause of valid knowledge is complete, why does it not produce valid knowledge when a fault is present?

original: rang dang 'gal ba'i skyon nye ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang dang 'gal ba'i skyon nye ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the fault that contradicts it is near.

original: tshad ma ma yin @257a * //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin @257a * //
translated: But if it is not a valid cognition,

original: pa yin pa la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: pa yin pa la yang mtshungs te /
translated: then the same is true of that.

original: de yang de'i tshe rang dang 'gal ba'i rgyu dbang po la sogs pa la nye ba'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de'i tshe rang dang 'gal ba'i rgyu dbang po la sogs pa la nye ba'i phyir skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And at that time, it would not arise because the cause that contradicts it, the sense faculty and so on, is near.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'gal ba'i rgyu'i skyon gzhan las tshad ma nyid mi skye bar 'dod par 'gyur na rang gi rgyu nyid nus pa ma nyams pa yin na de'i tshe ci'i phyir btang snyoms su byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'gal ba'i rgyu'i skyon gzhan las tshad ma nyid mi skye bar 'dod par 'gyur na rang gi rgyu nyid nus pa ma nyams pa yin na de'i tshe ci'i phyir btang snyoms su byed /
translated: Moreover, if you assert that a valid cognition does not arise from another due to the fault of a contradictory cause, then at that time, if its own cause is unimpaired, why would you be indifferent to it?

original: gal te rang gi 'bras bu skyed par mi 'dod kyang btsan thabs su skyed par byed pa de lta na ni des na bdag nyid kyi nus pa nyams pa med pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rang gi 'bras bu skyed par mi 'dod kyang btsan thabs su skyed par byed pa de lta na ni des na bdag nyid kyi nus pa nyams pa med pa gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you assert that it does not wish to generate its own effect, but it is forcibly generated, then in that case, its own unimpaired power would be evident.

original: skyon gyi nus pa nyams par byas pa'i phyir btang snyoms su byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: skyon gyi nus pa nyams par byas pa'i phyir btang snyoms su byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that you are indifferent to it because the power of the fault is impaired,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa'i rgyu yang dbang po dag gis nus pa nyams par byas par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa'i rgyu yang dbang po dag gis nus pa nyams par byas par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The reason why it is not a valid cognition is that it would follow that the sense faculties would be impaired in their capacity.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / shes pa yang mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir dang / shes pa yang mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference, and because it would follow that consciousness would not arise.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar skyon gyi nus pa nyams pa nyid kyi phyir dbang pos tshad ma nyid skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang skyed par mi byed de /üîΩnus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar skyon gyi nus pa nyams pa nyid kyi phyir dbang pos tshad ma nyid skyed par mi byed pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang skyed par mi byed de / nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as the sense faculty does not generate valid cognition because the capacity for error is impaired, so too it does not generate consciousness because it lacks the capacity.

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma nyid rnam par shes pa'i rgyu tsam gyis bskyed par bya bar 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma nyid rnam par shes pa'i rgyu tsam gyis bskyed par bya bar 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, valid cognition would not be established as generated by the mere cause of consciousness.

original: de skye na yang mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skye na yang mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even when it arises, it does not arise.

original: gang zhig gang skye ba na yang nges par mi skye ba de ni de dang lhan cig rgyu gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang skye ba na yang nges par mi skye ba de ni de dang lhan cig rgyu gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: That which definitely does not arise when something arises is not a co-cause of that,

original: dper na ko tra ba'i myu gu skye ba na s'a lu'i myu gu mi skye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ko tra ba'i myu gu skye ba na s'a lu'i myu gu mi skye ba bzhin no //
translated: just as when a ko·π≠rava seed arises, a rice sprout does not arise.

original: rnam par shes pa skyes na yang tshad ma nyid nges par skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyes na yang tshad ma nyid nges par skye ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And when consciousness has arisen, valid knowledge does not necessarily arise. This is the nonobservation of a related object.

original: 'ga' zhig gi de'i rang bzhin ma nyams na bdag nyid du gyur pa nyams par bya bar nus pa yang ma yin no //üîΩde lta yin dang / rang las dmigs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi de'i rang bzhin ma nyams na bdag nyid du gyur pa nyams par bya bar nus pa yang ma yin no // de lta yin dang / rang las dmigs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: If the nature of something is not impaired, it cannot be impaired by anything else.üîΩIf that were the case,üîΩyou would have to accept that all objects

original: tshad ma nyid ces bzung bar gyis //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ces bzung bar gyis //
translated: are valid cognitions by nature.

original: rang las yod pa'i nus pa ni //
analyzed: rang las yod pa'i nus pa ni //
translated: The potential that exists by nature

original: gzhan gyis gzhom par nus ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gzhom par nus ma yin //
translated: cannot be destroyed by anything else.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu'ang 'don par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu'ang 'don par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: You would not be able to recite such verses.

original: 'di snyam du dbang po la sogs pa tsam tshad ma nyid kyi rgyur mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dbang po la sogs pa tsam tshad ma nyid kyi rgyur mi 'dod de /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúWe do not assert that mere faculties and so on are the cause of valid knowledge.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is it?

original: khyad par nyid de skyon dang bral ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par nyid de skyon dang bral ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the special state free of error.

original: des na ji skad du bshad @257b pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na ji skad du bshad @257b pa'i skyon du thal bar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore the previously explained errors do not follow.‚Äù

original: gal te da lta na yon tan dang ldan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gzhan kho na tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te da lta na yon tan dang ldan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa gzhan kho na tshad ma nyid kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the other collection of faculties endowed with the qualities that is the cause of valid knowledge,

original: yon tan dang lhan cig pa nyid la skyon dang bral ba nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang lhan cig pa nyid la skyon dang bral ba nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is because it is endowed with the qualities that it is free from faults.

original: de lta yin dang tshogs pa gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba nyid du ma grub po zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang tshogs pa gzhan gyis bskyed par bya ba nyid du ma grub po zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: If that were so, it could not be said that it is produced by another collection.

original: yon tan gyi bya ba ni skyon dang bral ba nyid la yin gyi tshad ma skyed pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yon tan gyi bya ba ni skyon dang bral ba nyid la yin gyi tshad ma skyed pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The function of the qualities is to be free from faults, not to produce valid knowledge.

original: bral ba ni med pa nyid kyi phyir de la 'ga' zhig rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bral ba ni med pa nyid kyi phyir de la 'ga' zhig rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Since freedom is nonexistence, it is not reasonable for it to be anything.

original: ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa la bya ba 'ga' zhig srid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dngos po med pa la bya ba 'ga' zhig srid pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not possible for something that is nonexistent, like the horn of an ass, to have any function.

original: gang yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rnam par shes pa skyed pa kho na tshul gsum pa'i rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa la tshad ma nyid skyed par byed pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'di yang ma grub te /
analyzed: gang yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las rnam par shes pa skyed pa kho na tshul gsum pa'i rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa la tshad ma nyid skyed par byed pa mthong ngo zhes bya ba 'di yang ma grub te /
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúThe cause of the production of valid knowledge is only the production of consciousness by the presence or absence of the object, because in inference and so on, the cause of the production of valid knowledge is only the production of consciousness by the presence or absence of the triply characterized object‚Äù is not established.

original: tshul gsum pa nyid 'ba' zhig rjes su dpag pa'i skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul gsum pa nyid 'ba' zhig rjes su dpag pa'i skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The triply characterized object alone is not the cause of the production of inference.

original: 'o na ci zhe na rtogs pa po la yod pa'i mi rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed la sogs pa'i yon tan yang yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na rtogs pa po la yod pa'i mi rmongs par dran pa'i 'du byed la sogs pa'i yon tan yang yin te /
translated: What is the cause of the production of inference? It is the quality of the cognizer, such as the unconfused recollection that is conditioned by the object.

original: ji ltar tshul gsum yod na yang 'brel pa dran pa'i 'du byed nyams pa dang 'brel pa ma rtogs pa'i sgrub pa po la rjes su dpag pa mi skye bas de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis rnam par shes pa skyed pa kho na
analyzed: ji ltar tshul gsum yod na yang 'brel pa dran pa'i 'du byed nyams pa dang 'brel pa ma rtogs pa'i sgrub pa po la rjes su dpag pa mi skye bas de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis rnam par shes pa skyed pa kho na
translated: Just as even when the triply characterized object exists, inference does not arise in the proponent who is impaired with respect to the conditioned recollection of the relation or who has not understood the relation, therefore the production of consciousness by the presence or absence of the object is not the cause of the production of valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma nyid skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ma grub te /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ma grub te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cause of the production of valid knowledge is only the production of consciousness by the presence or absence of the object‚Äù is not established.

original: des na bzlog pa bzlog par dka' ba nyid du de rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: des na bzlog pa bzlog par dka' ba nyid du de rnam par gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that what is reversed is difficult to reverse.

original: gang yang phyin ci log gi shes pa'i 'bras bu ni dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las skye ba ma yin no zhes smra ba de yang ches gzu lums yin te /
analyzed: gang yang phyin ci log gi shes pa'i 'bras bu ni dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las skye ba ma yin no zhes smra ba de yang ches gzu lums yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is sheer recklessness to claim that the effect of erroneous cognition does not arise from the nature of the sense faculty, etc.

original: phyin ci log gi shes pa ni dbang po la ma ltos par yang skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi shes pa ni dbang po la ma ltos par yang skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: For it follows, absurdly, that erroneous cognition would arise even without depending on the sense faculties,

original: rang bzhin gang zhig gang las mi skye ba de ni de la ltos par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhig gang las mi skye ba de ni de la ltos par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: because whatever nature does not arise from something else cannot reasonably depend on it,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: rab rib can la sogs pa'i zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni dbang po la ma ltos par skye ba yang ma yin no //üîΩgzhan @258a * //
analyzed: rab rib can la sogs pa'i zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni dbang po la ma ltos par skye ba yang ma yin no //üîΩgzhan @258a * //
translated: The cognition of a second moon, etc. of one who has eye disease does not arise without depending on the sense faculties.

original: yang gal te don la mi slu ba nyid du brjod pa de'i tshe gang gis de la khyed cag tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis tha snyad du 'gyur ba bsgrubs pa las byung ba'i blo ji ltar don la mi slu ba nyid du rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang gal te don la mi slu ba nyid du brjod pa de'i tshe gang gis de la khyed cag tshu rol mthong ba rnams kyis tha snyad du 'gyur ba bsgrubs pa las byung ba'i blo ji ltar don la mi slu ba nyid du rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Moreover, if you say that it is nondeceptive with respect to its object, then how could you who are proponents of the conventional, who see only the near side, know that the mind that arises from the proof is nondeceptive with respect to its object?

original: de'i 'bras bu ma rtogs pa dag gis ni de'i nus pa nges par gzung bar nug  pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ma rtogs pa dag gis ni de'i nus pa nges par gzung bar nug  pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who do not understand its effect cannot ascertain its power,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that anything could arise from anything.

original: de lta bu yin dang rig byed gang kho na'i tshad ma nyid bstan par byed par 'dod pas tshig gi dri ba 'di thams cad nye bar 'god par byed pas de nyid kyi de ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ni 'bras thug po che don du gnyer ba phub
analyzed: de lta bu yin dang rig byed gang kho na'i tshad ma nyid bstan par byed par 'dod pas tshig gi dri ba 'di thams cad nye bar 'god par byed pas de nyid kyi de ma grub pa'i phyir 'di ni 'bras thug po che don du gnyer ba phub
translated: If that were so, then you who wish to teach that the Vedas are valid knowledge would be setting forth all these verbal questions, but that is not established.üîΩTherefore this is just like a farmer who wants to grow barley but plants rice seeds.
